She lives in her own house with her two children, aged 17 and 22 years. 

Susuana is asking for a loan amount of 1,300 GHS (Ghana cedis) that will allow her to buy more school uniforms and kids' wear at wholesale prices and sell them to schools. 

In this way, she will be able to obtain a better income from her sales and give her children everything they need with no limitations.

loans.use: To buy enough uniforms to sell to schools.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a 59-year-old married woman and a mother of three grown-up children from Panglao, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 30 years with her husband.
 
Prudencia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. In the future, Prudencia dreams of expanding their fishing business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets.

loans.name: Toufic

texts.en:
Toufic is a 23-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single and living with his parents and two working siblings. His father is the main source of income for the family. 

Toufic is a great man who loves his family and really wants to offer them a respectable life; this is the reason why he’s working nonstop, on his own, to be able to take some responsibilities off of his father. He’s specialized in installing solar-energy systems. He’s an honest man and above all punctual, which is what make his customers loyal to him. 

Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase new tools and solar equipment. This Kiva loan will facilitate his business operations and increase his sales. This is how Toufic works to collect higher revenues and will help his family live a very comfortable life from hard work.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and solar-energy system equipment.

loans.name: Madres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Ofelia de 42 años es integrante de la alcancía Madres Emprendedoras. Ella es madre de 03 hijos al ser madre soltera tiene que trabajar muy duro para darle a sus hijos lo necesario. Ofelia se dedica principalmente a la venta de comidas son aproximadamente 09 años que se dedica a este negocio y lo aprendió gracias a su hermano que también se dedica a lo mismo, el negocio está ubicado en su casa, allí prepara diversos alimentos para vender menú principalmente a los trabajadores de la zona quienes acuden a su negocio para comprarle comida, por otro lado ha incursionado en la venta de productos de belleza y ropa, el dinero de su préstamo lo utilizara para alquilar un puesto en un mercado de su zona donde iniciara su negocio. Ofelia esta agradecida por este préstamo que le permite cumplir su sueño y espera seguir en EDAPROSPO por muchos años.
Ofelia aparece en la foto con buzo color negro y polo morado.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 42 years old and is a member of the 'Madres Emprendedoras' ['Entrepreneurial Mothers'] group of borrowers. She is the mother of 3 children; being a single mother she has to work very hard to give her children what they need. Ofelia makes a living primarily from selling food. For approximately 9 years she has made a living from this business and she learned it thanks to her brother who also works in this business. 

The business is located in her house; she prepares various foods there and sells her menu primarily to workers in the area who come to her business to buy food. She has also ventured into the sale of beauty products and clothing. The money from her loan will be used to rent a space in a market in her area where she can start her business.  Ofelia is grateful for this loan, as it allows her to fulfill her dream, and she hopes to continue with EDAPROSPO for many years.

Ofelia appears in the photo with the black jogging suit and purple shirt.

loans.use: to rent a space for her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
This is Jane. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used for the maintenance of her washing machines. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan for the maintenance of her washing machines. She also sells rice retail and she will also use the money to buy sacks of rice. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jane dreams that her businesses will continue to expand and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her washing machines.

loans.name: Matormah

texts.en:
Matormah is 38 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married with five children between 4 and 22 years old. All of them live at home and only two attend school. Matormah was unfortunate and unable to attend school.  

She has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market for eight years. She started this business when she thought of being able to do something for herself, and learned this trade from her mother. She spends ten hours a day, six days a week with her business.

Matormah is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, coal, oil, pepper, fish, bush-meat, etc. for her business. Her future plan is to educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, coal, oil, pepper, fish, bush-meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Surat Group

texts.en:
Surat is a 40-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and five daughters. Since 2004, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop and usually sells his vegetables in the central market. He always sells fresh vegetables and his clients are satisfied with his rates. 

Surat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. Her husband is a very hardworking and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

NOTE: In the picture Surat is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fresh vegetables.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a friendly and kind woman. She’s from Lebanon and is 54 years old. She’s divorced and living with her only parent and siblings. Ghada and her youngest brother are working really hard to provide the family with the needed income. Since she noticed that their income does not satisfy their needs, she decided to start her own business. She sells a wide variety of sportswear and sports equipment from which she earns a fair amount of money daily. 

To better develop her work, she’s requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more merchandise for her business. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and thus, improve her income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 29 years old and has three children. Amer works hard to provide for his family’s needs, working in his grocery store while his wife takes care of their children. In his grocery store, Amer offers to provide all the basic needs of a family like dairy products, juices, canned food, snacks, shampoos and detergents. He established his business in 2011 and has gained all the needed experience through previously working at a similar grocery store for several years. Amer now has an employee hired and has gained good fame in his neighborhood thanks to the good quality and competitive prices of his offered goods.

Amer is requesting a youth loan of $2,100. He will use this loan to renovate his grocery store to attract more customers. Amer believes that this loan will positively effect the improvement of his business and his profits, so he will be able to provide his children with better living standards.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store.

loans.name: Maisha Group

texts.fr: La cliente Naweza est une conseillère  du  groupement d’affaire Maisha, entrepreneur,  âgée de 45  ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Son conjoint est un modéliste couturier. La cliente est vendeuse des souliers. Elle étale ses marchandises au long de la rue.  Elle commença cette affaire avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima.  Il ya environs 2 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  50 paires de souliers à marchander. L’insécurité, la crise financière  sont de défis majeurs pour son activité. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison. In fine, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit. Il sied de signaler que, une cliente porte son bébé au dos.
texts.en: Naweza is a member and advisor of the Maisha business group. She is a 45 year old entrepeneur and is married and mother to eight children. Her husband is a designer and dressmaker. Naweza sells shoes on the roadside. She started this business with a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been trading shoes for around 2 years. This new loan will enable her to buy 50 pairs of shoes that she can sell. The biggest challenges for her businessy are lack of security and the financial crisis. She wants to increase her capital, educate her children and build a house. Ultimately, she would like to thank Hekima for supporting her through microcredit. It should be noted that one member of the group has a baby on her back.

loans.use: to buy 50 pairs of shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Watchoee

texts.en: Watchoee is 46 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County. Margibi County is the highest producer of rubber in Liberia. She is single with 8 children between the ages of 15 and 30 years old, of which only one of them lives at home and attends school. Watchoee was unfortunately unable to attend school. She has been selling items such as toothpaste, soap, hair-grease etc in her local market for the past ten years. She started this business with money given to her by her brother to help herself. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more stocks of toothpaste, soap, hair-grease etc for her business. Her future plan is to educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of toothpaste, soap, hair-grease etc for her business.

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah is 24 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest production area of rubber plantations in Liberia. She is single with three children between 16 months and 7 years old; all of them live at home and only two attend school. She stopped her education at grade 5.

She has been selling slippers in the local market for the past two years, and she started this business with money given to her by her mother to help herself. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. Her future plan is to go back to school and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 43-year-old hardworking and diligent women. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and three sons. Her husband and all of her sons are running a car decoration and accessories shop. This is the only source of income for her family. Currently, they are facing many problems in business as the current stock of car accessories is almost finished, and they have no funds available to purchase more stock. 

Shaheen has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can continue his business and purchase a new variety of car accessories and decoration kits like car chargers, fog lights, seat covers, neon lights, MP3 and DVD players, etc. With the profit amount, she is going to make arrangements for the marriage of her son and for the expansion of their business.

She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them, and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

Note: In the picture, Shaheen is carrying a passbook in hand.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a car-accessories shop.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en: Wael is 19 years old from Gaza. He owns a shop for mobile selling and has been maintaining it since 2011. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy an electricity generator, display stands and some mobile phones for his mobile shop. Wael hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy an electricity generator, display stands and some mobile phones for his mobile shop.

loans.name: Nidaa

texts.en: Nidaa is a 25-years-old woman from Gaza. She is married and has 4 children. Three of her children go to school. Nidaa has owned a grocery store since January 2011 and she has one employee. She has asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a glass door and some goods for her grocery store. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase sales and thus improve her family's income.

loans.use: to buy a glass door and some goods for the grocery store.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 32 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber plantations in Liberia. Musu is married with two children, ages 10 and 13; they live at home and are in school. Musu was unable to attend school, and for four years now she has been selling body cream, perfume and hair grease around her community and market. She started this business with small goods from her friend as sell-pay (to have the goods on credit, sells them and returns the principle) and she learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, perfume and hair grease for her business. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, perfume and hair grease for her business.

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is a youth client from Iraq. He is 27 years old, single and lives with his family consisting of 4 members, 2 of whom assist Mouhammad in providing the family income.

Mouhammad owns a small shop where he sells clothes for children. He established his business in 2011 and has gained good experience in this field. Mouhammad now has an employee and has gained an excellent reputation in his surrounding area thanks to his affordable prices.

Mouhammad is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his shop. By this loan, Mouhammad aims to continue to grow and improve his business and be able to provide his parents better living standards.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 33 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County in Liberia. She is single with two children, ages 6 and 11, who are in school. She did not go to school. 

For five years now she has been selling kool-aid and cold water in the local market. She started this business with a little money from her fiancee, and she learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase a cooler, water, and kool-aid for her business. She plans to improve her children's future by educating them and building a house.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler, water, and kool-aid for her business.

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has two children. Mouhammad works hard to provide his family with an income, while his wife takes care of their children.

Mouhammad owns a small shop where he irons cloths. He gained his work experience through previously working as an employee at a similar shop for several years. In 2011, Mouhammad established his own business, and now he has an employee. He is gradually gaining the respect of his neighborhood, thanks to the good quality of his offered service.

Mouhammad is requesting a loan of $1,800 loan to buy a unique washing machine, customized for his use. Mouhammad is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide for his family’s need and be able to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy a unique washing machine, customized for his use.

loans.name: Moutasam

texts.en:
Moutasam is a married Iraqi client, who is 35 years old and a father of one child. 

Moutasam owns a bakery and specializes in baking bread for individuals, hotels and restaurants. He has been running this business since 2007, and it has been rapidly growing. Now Moutasam has two employees and has been gaining fame and respect in his neighborhood.

Moutasam is requesting a loan of $3,000. He will use this loan to renovate his bakery and to increase his inventory of flour and oil to increase his production. Through this loan, Moutasam aims to successfully grow his business, increase his profits and provide his family with better conditions and a brighter future.

loans.use: to renovate his bakery and to increase his inventory of flour and oil.

loans.name: Viebeth Joy

texts.en:
Viebeth Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling cashew nuts in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of cashew nuts to sell.

Viebeth Joy has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from her general store.

Viebeth Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 51-year-old married client from Iraq who has three children. Ahmad works hard to provide his family’s income all by himself.

Ahmad owns a grocery store where he sells all the basic needs of a family like dairy products, canned food, snacks, soft drinks and detergents. He has been in this field since 1999 and has gained good experience.  Now, Ahmad has a hired employee and is well-known in his surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Ahmad is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD to install a display window for his grocery store. Ahmad is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide his family better living standards.

loans.use: to install a display window for his grocery store

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 44 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital City of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber plantations in Liberia. She is married with four children aged between 22 and 30. 

Hawa did not go to school, but she has been engaged in a business to help herself and her family. For the past ten years she has been selling rice by the cup, peppers, oil, etc. in the local market. She started this business with a small amount of money given to her by her husband, and she learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice by the bag, peppers, oil, etc. for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice by the bag, peppers, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 55 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school. She sells bananas in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from selling cashews.

Nimfa is requesting a loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional bananas to sell. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to sell.

loans.name: Tuungane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mushonga est  conseillère  du  groupement d’affaire Tuungane, entrepreneur expérimentée,  âgée de 51 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants dont 2 n’étudient pas suite aux charges familiales multiples. La cliente est vendeuse de café et lait calleux. Elle est aussi vendeuse des plastics. Elle étale ses marchandises généralement dans son magasin, parfois, elle les expose au marché et à son domicile.  Elle commença cette affaire à son bas âge, (elle était orpheline),  avec son fonds  propre qu’elle s’était constitué à  travers les petits revenus qu’elle gagnait, aussitôt, elle exécute de petits travaux.  Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 70kg de café et 8 bidons de lait calleux,etc. Les taxes exorbitantes  sont de défis majeurs pour son activité. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants. In fine, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
The borrower, Mushonga, is the representative of the Tuungane business group.  She is 51 years old and an experienced entrepreneur.  She is also a widow and the mother of seven children, two of whom are not in school, because of the many household expenses.

Mushonga sells coffee and curdled milk.  Additionally, she sells plastic items.  She displays her goods, usually in her shop, but sometimes also at the market or at home.  As she was an orphan, she started in this business at a very young age,  using her own funds, built up from the income she received from small jobs. 

This new loan will be used to buy 70 kg. of coffee, 8 cans of curdled milk etc.  Extremely high taxes are a major challenge for her commercial activity.

Mushonga would like to increase her capital and educate her children.  In the end, she thanks Hekima very much for providing support to small entrepreneurs through Microcredit.

loans.use: to buy 70 kg. of coffee, 8 cans of curdled milk, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Doña Eugenia trabaja desde hace más de ocho años haciendo posible los sueños de muchos costarricenses por medio del otorgamiento de crédito productivo, a ella le preocupa no tener una caja de seguridad donde custodiar los documentos de garantía de los beneficiarios, ella necesita comprarla lo antes posible, razón por la cual está solicitando un millón de colones exactos (¢1.000.000) ya que este es el costo de la misma. Eugenia manifiesta que al adquirir este equipo se sentirá más tranquila y segura, ya que por el momento estos documentos permanecen en un archivador de mínima seguridad .
texts.en: For more than eight years, Eugenia has worked to make the dreams of many Costa Ricans possible by granting them a production loan. It worries her that she doesn't have a safe where she can keep her beneficiaries' loan guarantee documents. She needs to buy one as soon as possible. For this reason she is asking for a million Costa Rican colones exactly (¢1,000,000), as this is how much the safe costs. Eugenia states that she will feel much calmer and secure once she has bought this equipment, as these documents are currently in a minimum security file box.

loans.use: to buy a safe

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 28 years old and has a single child. Sabah is the sole provider of his family. He is a grocer. 

In his shop, Sabah offers to sell canned food, dairy products, bottled juices and detergents. He has been in this field since 1994 and has gained good experience. Now Sabah has a hired employee and has been growing rapidly with fame and respect.

Sabah is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. The aim of this loan is to pay the annual rent of his grocery store as well as to buy more goods to sell. By this loan, Sabah will successfully grow his business and increase his profits and will be able to take better care of his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his grocery store as well as to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Maitham

texts.en:
Maitham is a married Iraqi client who is 41 years old and has 4 children. Maitham solely provides his family income through working in his grocery store while his wife takes care of their children.

In his grocery store, Maitham provides different goods for his customers like dairy products, canned food, juices and detergents. He established his business in 2000 and gained good experience in this field.

Maitham is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD. This loan will help him to buy a motor generator and to buy more goods to sell. He believes that by the increase of his business and the increase of his profits, he will be able to change his current financial conditions and provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator and to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 37 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

Shirley has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and buying and selling rice.

Shirley aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en:
Daniel's group is made up of three traders who are into the sales of jewelry, water tanks, soap and cream.

Daniel is 48 years old. He lives in Teshie with his wife Kate and three children, who are going to school. Daniel requested a loan of GHS 300 to inject into his jewelry business.

This is his third loan with ID-Ghana, and he, together with Boga and Margaret, needs a total of GHS 1,000 to be able to buy enough to sell to their customers.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Ragheb

texts.en:
Ragheb is a 40-year-old client from Iraq. He is married and has three children. Ragheb works hard to provide his family income, all by himself.

Ragheb owns a grocery store where he sells all the basic needs of a family, such as canned food, dairy products, soft drinks, snacks, and detergents. He has been in this business since 2010 and has gained good experience. Ragheb is now well-known in his neighborhood, with an excellent reputation.

Ragheb is requesting a loan of USD 3,000. He will use this loan to renovate his grocery store by installing a new floor and to increase his food inventory to sell. Ragheb is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he may be able to provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store by installing a new floor and to increase his food inventory to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 53 years old and has six children, one of whom is in school.

Norma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her buy-and-sell fish business.

Norma has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chibunga est  vice présidente  du  groupement d’affaire Umoja, entrepreneur expérimentée,  âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants, qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un chauffeur. La cliente est Enseignante dans une école primaire dans le village de Kavumu. Elle est aussi vendeuse des plastiques. Elle étale ses marchandises au long de la rue.  Elle commença cette affaire avec son fonds qu’elle s’était constitué à  travers  de son salaire vers les années 1988. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  divers vases de plastiques (30 bassins, 10 sceaux, 50 assiettes, 20 gobelets, etc.). Les taxes exorbitantes  sont de défis majeurs pour son activité. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants. In fine, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs. Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
The borrower, Chibunga, is the vice-president of the Umoja business group.  She is 48 years old and a hardworking entrepreneur.  She is married and the mother of six children who all go to school. Her husband is a driver.  

Chibunga works as primary school teacher in the village of Kavumu.  Additionally, she sells plastic items, displaying her merchandise in the street.  She started in this business using her own funds, built up from a salary she received around 1988.

Chibunga will use this new loan to buy various plastic items (30 tubs, 10 buckets, 50 plates, 20 cups etc.).  Extremely high taxes constitute a major challenge for her commercial activity.

Chibunga would like to increase her capital and educate her children.  In the end, she thanks Hekima very much for providing support to small entrepreneurs through microcredit.

It should be noted that [in the photo] one of the borrowers is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy various plastic items (30 tubs, 10 buckets, 50 plates, 20 cups etc...)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nahayat

texts.en: Nahayat is a 35-years-old hardworking woman. She is an educated, well-mannered and responsible mother of 4 children. Her husband works in a government organization. For the better future of her son, Nahayat has been doing a part-time business selling ladies shoes from her house. Nahayat has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to open a shop in the market to run her business properly as she does not get enough customers in her house. She will also purchase new varieties of shoes and in this way, she can expand her business. With her profits, she plans to send her son to the best school in town. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping her.

loans.use: to expand her shoe business

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en: Gertrudes is 43 years old and lives in Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with 4 children. To earn a living, Gertrudes has a business selling dishes. She earns about PHP 12,000.00 each month doing this type of work. Gertrudes has requested a loan to support her business. Gertrudes has been a member of PMPC for less than a year. In the future, Gertrudes would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

location.town: Pagadian - Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en: Zohra, is a 46-years-old mother of three sons and three daughters. She is living in one of the poorly developed areas of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store since 2009 and wants to expand it by purchasing more goods, but because of financial constraints, he finds this difficult. For this purpose, Zohra has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan, for the growth of her husband's general store. He would purchase items such as bread, eggs, detergent, tea, coffee, washing powder etc for his general store .This will help in increasing their monthly savings and improving their children's future as well. She is hopeful that the loan will result in a positive and productive outcome for them so that they can lead a happy life.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her husband's general store

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer.  She deals in the production of local soap  in Akpafu, Hohoe, which she has been doing for five years. To prepare her local soap, Rosina burns cocoa pods into ashes and later soaks the ashes in water. She then boils the mixture into a porridge form, adds palm oil, and continues to stir. When it reaches the desired color, she takes it off the fire, allows it to cool, and then molds into various sizes.
  
Rosina is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy palm oil, firewood, cocoa pods, and cooking pot. She hopes to save the new profits from her business towards her old age.  She helps her husband in feeding the family and assisting with their children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, firewood, cocoa pods, and cooking pot.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a single mother of two children, aged ten and four years old. She is a retail distributor of cereals in Bomet town. She learned about Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) from some women in the market who are already registered.

She has successfully paid off her previous loan and has now been advanced a second loan of KES 40,000 which will help her to transport cereals to the now wider network of her growing customer base. The business is doing well since the season's harvest favored it.

Gladys hopes to expand her warehouse from the increased proceeds. Her dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: pay transport charges for her cereals.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 38 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Erma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Erma requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Erma has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Erma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is 34 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marissa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marissa applied for a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for the repair of her fishing boat. Marissa has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Hervo

texts.en: Hervis, a 31-year-old Egyptian Albanian who is applying for a loan for the first time, lives in a major city in southern Albania and sells used items, such as clothing and shoes, as well as cheap kitchen wares, to local people, for a living. He does not sell at the Egyptian/Roma market where some of his community members sell, because he wants to avoid the booth taxes and other charges; thus, for the moment, he sells in the streets. Hervis is married and has a seven-year-old child, and he has been the sole financial provider since they started their family. They plan on expanding their family soon, so he says he will have to expand his sales as well. The loan that Hervis is applying for will be used to buy items for resale.

loans.use: to buy used seasonal clothes for resale.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married and has 4 children. She has received schooling through middle school level. Justine sells foodstuffs and smoked fish in Akpafu, Hohoe, which she has done since 2009. Her husband is a farmer. Justine uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children's school fees and buying their books. 

Justine will use this loan to purchase a variety of foodstuffs from the farmers to sell at the big towns, as well as assorted fish to sell in her community. With the new profits from her expanded business, Justine plans to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of foodstuffs from the farmers to sell at the big towns, as well as assorted fish to sell in her community.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary smokes and sells fish in Akpafu, Hohoe Township. To smoke the fish, she buys fresh fish from the fishermen or from the cold store and brings the fish home to clean and wash. Once she drains the water from the fish, the fish will be ready to be smoked. She prepares firewood and a traditionally-built oven to smoke the fish. The cooking time for the fish varies depending on the size of the fish and their arrangement in the oven. 
The most important thing about this process is that the smoke, not the fire, cooks the fish. The smoke gives the fish its dark color. Green leaves are used as coverings for the fish to prevent the smoke from escaping into the air. The heat should also be moderate as too much heat would not allow the fish to cook properly.
Mary has never received schooling because she started doing business at a tender age. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Mary has been smoking and selling fish for the past 25 years. She assists her husband in caring for the home. Her loan will be used to buy cartons of different fish to enable her smoke on larger scale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to enable her to increase her working capital and also move toward the introduction of selling frozen fish.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fish to enable her to smoke the fish on a larger scale.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a 25-year-old, hard-working mother. She is married and blessed with two children, ages 6 and 3. She learned about KADET LTD from some regular customers who are already being funded by KADET LTD. 

She has run a retail shop for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 18,000. Her husband brings home additional income as well. With a first loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD, she plans to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products such as sweets, tea leaves, maize flour and rice.

The anticipated profits will be reinvested into her business for expansion. Her future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to restock her retail shop with a variety of consumable products

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en: Hamza is a 43-year-old married Lebanese man living with his wife and five young children, who attend school. He is the main source of income for the family. In 2009, he decided to get involved in the car-trading business. Because of his negotiating talent and skills and his friendly personality, he was able to succeed in this domain. However, his financial results are barely permitting him to cover the high cost of living, which is why he has been working in the internal security forces, to be able to enhance his family’s standard of living. Today, he is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children’s school fees. His purpose is to help them achieve high educational levels.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace is a petty trader who also deals in frozen chicken and fish at Akpafu, Hohoe Township. Peace has received education only to junior high school, and she couldn’t continue due to her parents’ lack of funds. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a chain saw operator. Peace has been in business for four years. She is responsible for feeding the members of the household and her parents. Her loan will be used to buy different types of fish. She hopes to use some of the new profits in her business and to reinvest in her business to enable her get together enough money to acquire a shop.

loans.use: to buy different types of fish for resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is married and has two children. She has received schooling to junior high school. Nancy’s business is selling provisions and minerals to the people of Akpafu, Hohoe, as she has done for the past seven years, since she couldn’t continue with her schooling. Her husband is a petty trader. Nancy uses her income for the daily feeding of the household. Nancy will use the loan to buy sachets of milo, varieties of canned fish, and minerals. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nancy plans to save to acquire a bigger shop some day.

loans.use: to buy sachets of milo, varieties of canned fish, and minerals for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for making handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a petty trader at Akpafu, Hohoe. Comfort has received education up to the primary level. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Comfort has been into petty trading for the past 13 years, enablling her to be independent and be able to support her family. She helps her husband to care for the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy smoked fish, tin fish, vegetables and bags of rice. She hopes to save and use the new profits from her business towards supporting herself when she is elderly.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish, tin fish, vegetables, bags of rice.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support her family. Mercedita is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Mercedita requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Mercedita has been in this business for 39 years now.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Andrea Jusseth

texts.es:
Andrea es una mujer de 29 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar a su pequeño, ya que ella es padre y madre para él; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Andrea se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con su pequeño hijo y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Andrea trabaja como cajera en un supermercado de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Andrea se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de la habitación que comparte con su pequeño, ya que esta se encuentra algo deteriorada y requiere de ponerle piso, pintarla y otros, de esta manera ella y su hijo podrán contar con un ambiente adecuado, más seguro, que brinde mayor seguridad, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su pequeño convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Andrea is a 29 year old woman who lives in the city of Chincha with her parents and small child, who is the main purpose of her life. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who devotes all her efforts to helping her small child get ahead because she is both father and mother to him. Thanks to her own effort and the support of her parents, Andrea is studying for a technical career in Business Administration.

In her spare time, she enjoys playing with her child and she occasionally cooks a delicious dish called “arroz chaufa” to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with a great deal of determination and dedication, Andrea works as a cashier in a super market in her city. She works approximately 8 hours every day and believes that she is doing well because of her good performance and the friendly way she treats others.

Andrea is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help she will be able to make improvements to the bedroom that she shares with her child. The bedroom is currently somewhat deteriorated and requires the installation of a floor, painting and other upgrades. In this way she and her son will be able to have a more suitable and safe environment that provides more security. Consequently she will continue working and striving to achieve her big dream of seeing her small son become a respectable professional

loans.use: to make improvements on a bedroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material for making curtains and covers

loans.name: Kariuki

texts.en: Kariuki used his previous loan to purchase sheep to rear. He is requesting his fifth loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy a dairy cow. He hopes to have a stable business and become a leading business man in his area.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en:
Lorpu is 34-years-old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the highest production of fish on the Liberian market. She is single with three children between ages 6 and 17 who are attending school and live at home. 

For ten years now she has been selling clothes in the community market. She spends 8 hours per day, six days a week. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and learned this trade from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, etc.) for her business. 

She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 43 years old and married, with three children, two of whom are in school. Divina works very hard to provide for them.

Divina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, soap, and bread.

Divina has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, soap, and bread.

loans.name: Kulkayir

texts.ru: Кулайыр – участник группы «Кулкайыр», ей 48 лет, мать 4 детей. Кулайыр работает кассиром в местном офисе Электросетей и в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 0,36 га земли с посевом зерновых культур, 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота с приплодом и 2 лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулайыр обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) , целью которого является покупка скота на откорм.  Доходы от кредита Кулайыр планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, и мечтает купить трактор для работ на поле.
texts.en:
Kulayir is a member of the "Kulkayir" group. She is 48 years old and the mother of four children. Kulayir works as a cashier at the local office of Elektrosetei and, as additional income for her family, is engaged in livestock and agriculture. Through hard work, her farm today has 0.36 hectares of land sown with grain crops, ten heads of sheep and goats with offspring, and two horses. 

In order to further develop her business, Kulayir turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS), with the purpose of buying livestock for fattening.

Kulayir plans to invest income from the loan to the further development of her business, and wants to buy a tractor to work the field.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas, and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old-growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Linet is married, and has three children. She and her husband have been farming their land for seven years and are currently growing a good variety of crops, including maize, beans, sweet potatoes, cassava, and other vegetables. 

When asked if she was excited about starting to keep bees, Linet said that she was and that beekeeping is "easy to manage" and a "good project." Linet plans to use the income generated from her hives to feed her family and to buy farming equipment, like jembes (hoes) and pangas (machetes). 

Linet's hope for the future is "for me and my family to have a good life; that is, for my kids to have good jobs, enough food, and a good house."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Anass

texts.en:
Anass is 20 years old, a single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a hard-working man who faces difficult challenges in order to succeed in his life. 

Anass collected an amount and intends to open a computer store. He likes to sell, to improve his living standards. He is responsible for his parents. 

Anass applied for a youth loan of YER 200,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy computers and a scan machine to use for his business. He hopes to increase his income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy computers and a scan machine to use for his business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 29 years old and lives in Montserrado County, the highest fish-producing region in Liberia. She is single with a five-year-old child who lives with her and is now in school. For ten years now, Comfort has been selling goods such as oil, rice and pepper in the local market. She started this business after it was given to her by her mother, from whom she learned her trade. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. In the future, she hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her business, such as oil, rice and pepper

loans.name: Leavy

texts.en:
Leavy lives in Kakamega town, outside of Kakamega county in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Leavy is married, and has three children. Both him and his wife have been farming for seven years, and are currently growing maize, vegetables and sugar cane on their land. Leavy is excited to begin beekeeping with Honey Care because he does not need to feed the bees to receive honey.

Leavy plans to use the income generated from his hives to pay his children's school fees and feed his family. When asked about his hopes and dreams for the future, Leavy said that he hopes "to build a good house for my family and for my children to get good jobs."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 31 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Javier no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Parrillada para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Javier trabaja como agente de seguridad en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Javier se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abarrotes y bebidas, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder abastecer su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes que desea iniciar, adicionalmente comprará una refrigeradora para vender bebidas heladas, de esta manera Javier podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Javier is a 31-year-old man. He is single and lives in the city of Pisco. He is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire for self-improvement. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the necessity to work from very young to help his parents, Javier was not able to study for a professional degree in Business Administration. In his free time he likes to play soccer, and in some occasions he barbecues some very tasty food to share with his family.

Through his own initiative, with much determination and dedication, Javier works as a security officer in a commercial business in his city. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes that it is going well for him because of his responsibility and the kind treatment that he provides to everyone.

Javier is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help provided he will be able to purchase groceries and drinks, which will serve him to stock the small business selling groceries that he wishes to open. Additionally, he will buy a refrigerator to sell cold drinks. With this, Javier will be able to serve more customers, and so he will continue working and making an effort to achieve his greatest dream of owning his own home.

loans.use: for the purchase of groceries and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corrugated iron, wood, and planks of wood, among other items.

loans.name: Jyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз – участник группы «Кулкайыр», ей 36 лет,  воспитывает 3 детей. Жылдыз в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 0,5 га земли с посевом зерновых культур, 1 корова с приплодом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жылдыз обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) , целью которого является покупка скота на откорм.  Доходы от кредита Жылдыз планирует вложить в постройку сарая.
texts.en:
Jyldyz is a member of the Kulkayir group. She is 36 years old and is raising three children. 

As the main income for her family, Jyldyz is engaged in raising livestock and agriculture. Through hard work, her farm today has 0.5 hectares of land sown with grain crops, and one cow with offspring. In order to further develop her business, Jyldyz turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS), with the purpose of buying cattle for fattening. 

Jyldyz plans to invest income from the loan to construct a shed.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Kurmanbubu

texts.ru: Курманбубу – лидер группы «Нурдоолот», ей 59 лет. Курманбубу работает уборщицей в местной школе и в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав с суммы (KGS) 8,000 сом в 1993 году. Благодаря упорному труду,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1,8 га земли с посевом зерновых культур, 25 головы  мелкого рогатого скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Курманбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) , целью которого является покупка мелкого скота на откорм и перепродажу.  Доходы от кредита Курманбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, а в этом году планирует провести электрическое отопление в дом.
texts.en:
Kurmanbubu is the leader of the Nurdoolot group. She is 59 years old. Kurmanbubu works as a cleaner in a local school and, as an additional source of income for her family, is engaged in raising livestock and agriculture, starting with a sum of 8,000 som (KGS) in 1993. Through hard work, her farm today has 1.8 hectares of land sown with grain crops, and 25 heads of small livestock. 

In order to further develop her business, Kurmanbubu turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS), with the purpose of buying livestock for fattening and resale.

Kurmanbubu plans to invest income from the loan to further developing her business and this year plans to install electric heating in her home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and the concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

David is married, and has four children. He has been farming for four years, and is currently growing maize, sugar cane and vegetables on his land. He likes beekeeping, because it is an easily manageable activity and Honey Care guarantees a market for the honey his hives make. 

This is David's first loan, and he says the income gathered from his hives "will help me to educate my children and feed my family." In the future, David hopes to save up enough money to expand to "a big farm."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives outside of Kakamega town, in western Kenya. Kakamega county is located close to the Ugandan border and an hour's drive from Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. The county contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Joseph is married, and has four children. His wife also farms, and they are currently growing sugar cane and vegetables on their land. Joseph is excited to start beekeeping, and thinks it is a good project because "the bees feed themselves." This is Joseph's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated from his hives to pay school fees for his children and buy food for his family. 

In the future, Joseph hopes to "buy a big farm so my family can have enough food."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Maribel, la socia  es soltera tiene 36 años de edad y tiene 02 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de salchipapas, pollipapas, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria en la puerta de su casa, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la soca desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, papas, mayonesa, entre otros.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de artesanía elaboración de refrigerios, venta de anticuchos, maestro constructor, agronomía.

La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Virgen del Carmen" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.
Sra. Maribel is single, 36 years old, and has two children. She alternates her daily chores with her business selling salchipapas [fried potatoes with hotdog] and pollipapas [shredded chicken breast with fries]. Maribel sells her products from the doorway of her home. She has had this business for some time, and it is going very well for her thanks to the hard work that she puts into her business every day. She wants to be able to keep working in order to keep supporting her family.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of oil, potatoes, mayonnaise, and other items.
The other group members sell handcrafts; build refrigerators; sell anticucho [small pieces of grilled skewered meat often marinated in vinegar and spices, often with a boiled potato or bread on the end of the skewer]; one is a master builder; another works in agriculture.
The member in the attached photo asked permission to come late to the meeting because of her work.
Maribel thanks those who will become part of this dream through this loan. She promises to repay her quotas as established.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, mayonnaise, and other items.

loans.name: Agustin Alberto

texts.es:
Agustin es un hombre de 58 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en distrito de Imperial, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Agustin pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Electricidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta leer periódicos y revistas, y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo cuando visita a sus familiares.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Agustin trabaja brindando servicios de reparación de electrodomésticos, el puede reparar lavadoras, refrigerados, televisores y otros, adicionalmente también brinda servicios de gasfitería, Agustin trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Agustin se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de diversos repuestos y herramientas que utiliza para realizar sus trabajos, de esta manera Agustin podrá seguir brindando sus servicios y atender a mas clientes, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción total de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Agustin is a 58-year-old man. He is single, and lives in the city of Cañete, in the Imperial district. He is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of his efforts to get ahead. Thanks to his effort and the support of his parents, Agustin was able to study for a technical degree as an electrician. In his free moments, he likes to read newspapers and magazines, and sometimes he cooks a very tasty Chicken and Rice when he visits his family members.

Through his own initiative, with much determination and dedication, Agustin works providing electrical appliance repair services. He can repair washing machines, refrigerators, televisions, and others. Additionally, he also provides plumbing services. Agustin works every day and can do so for approximately 10 hours. He believes that it is going well for him because of his experience and the kind treatment that he provides to his customers.

Agustin is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help provided, he will be able to purchase a variety of spare parts and tools that he uses to complete his jobs. In this way, Agustin will be able to continue providing his services and attend to more customers. So, he will continue working and making an effort to achieve his greatest dream of finishing the complete construction of his home.

loans.use: to purchase tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Kanchaiym

texts.ru: Канчайым  – участник группы «Нурдоолот», ей 57 лет, мать 4 детей. Канчайым пенсионерка и в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2,10 га земли с посевом зерновых культур. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Канчайым обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) , целью которого является покупка дойной коровы для доходов от реализации молока.  Доходы от кредита Канчайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, и мечтает построить новый дом со всеми удобствами.
texts.en:
Kanchaiym is a member of the Nurdoolot group. She is 57 years old and the mother of four children. Kanchaiym is retired and as the main source of income for her family is engaged in raising livestock and field crop cultivation. Through hard work, her farm today has 2.10 hectares of land sown with grain crops. 

In order to further develop her business, Kanchaiym turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS), with the purpose of buying a dairy cow to get profit from the sale of milk. 

Kanchaiym plans to invest income from the loan in further development of her business, and dreams of building a new house with all the comforts.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Olmakhon

texts.ru: Олмахон  – участник группы «Нурдоолот», ей 47 лет, мать 5 детей. Продажа молочных продуктов является основным доходом для ее семьи, позволяя зарабатывать средства круглый год. Также, Олмахон обрабатывает 2,1 га земли с фасолью и картофелем. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Олмахон обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) , целью которого является покупка одного бычка и закуп горюче-смазочных материалов на весенне-полевые работы.  Доходы от кредита Олмахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, и планирует построить новый сарай для  скота.
texts.en:
Olmakhon is a member of the Nurdoolot group. She is 47 years old and the mother of five children. 

Sale of dairy products is the main source of income for her family, allowing her to earn money all year round. Also, Olmakhon works 2.1 hectares of land with beans and potatoes. In order to further develop her business, Olmakhon turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS), with the goal of buying a calf as well as fuel and lubricants for the spring field work. 

Olmakhon plans to invest income from the loan to further develop her business and plans to build a new shed for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fuel

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Boniface is unmarried, and lives on his parents' farm. He is new to farming, but is currently helping to grow maize and beans. Boniface is excited to start beekeeping, because it is a good income source and does not require a large amount of space on a farm to be successful.

This is Boniface's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to help pay the secondary school fees of his siblings. In the future, Boniface hopes to save up enough money to buy his own piece of land, because right now he is staying on his father's farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old-growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Peter is married, and has three children. He is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper with Honey Care because the bees do all the work and he doesn't have to worry about caring for them. 

Peter has been farming for 45 years, and his wife also farms. He and his wife are very busy farmers and are currently growing bananas, maize, beans, sugar cane, passion fruits, and a tea plantation on their land. They also do dairy farming.

This is Peter's first loan and he plans to use the income generated from his hives to help pay those individuals who help him as farm laborers. In the future, Peter wants his "children to come back home and take care of the farm, because at my age I cannot do it on my own."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy lives outside of Kakamega town in western Kenya. Kakamega county is famous for its rain forest, which is the only rain forest of its type in Kenya. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Sammy is married, and has three children. Both he and his wife farm, and they are currently growing sugar cane on their land. Sammy is an experienced beekeeper, and he tends to several traditional log hives. When asked about beekeeping, he said: "It is my passion and I've been doing it ever since I was in primary school. I love bees."

He is excited to work with Honey Care because he likes that their methods of extracting honey do not destroy the honeycombs. This is his first loan, and he plans to use the income to pay school fees for his children and buy more hives. In the future, Sammy hopes to own at least 100 hives, and to take his beekeeping "to a higher level."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Fayzali

texts.ru:
Файзали повторно обратился за кредитом. Предыдущий заем он использовал для закупа мягких игрушек. Файзали занимается торговым бизнесом уже 20 лет. Вместе с ним работает младший сын. Его торговая точка находится на рынке района Дангара. На сегодняшний день он увеличил ассортимент товара. 
Файзали берет кредит для приобретения косметики, парфюмерии и детских игрушек, чтобы еще больше увеличить ассортимент своего товара. После получения кредита в Хумо его деятельность расширяется. Его бизнес хорошо продвигается. Он очень благодарен всем за поддержку.
texts.en:
Fayzali has applied for another loan. He used the previous loan for the purchase of plush toys. Fayzali has been engaged in the trade business for 20 years. His younger son works with him. His trade spot is located in a market in the Dangara region. To date, he has increased his range of goods. 

Fayzali is taking a loan for the purchase of cosmetics, perfumes, and children's toys, in order to further increase the range of his products. After receiving the loan from Humo, his activities will expand. His business is progressing well. 

He is very grateful for all the support.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, perfumes, and children's toys

loans.name: Jossias

texts.en:
Jossias is a 31-year-old married man with two children who are under school age. He has a business buying and selling coffee beans in Nyakabingo, Uganda, and also grows tomatoes for additional income. He started the business with the purpose of earning a living. With this loan, he is going to buy more coffee beans, which he will sell to middlemen who supply exporters. In the future, he hopes to have his own coffee factory so that he can make a higher income. 

Jossias' business is affected by changing weather patterns, which affect the availability of coffee. This forces him to travel long distances to buy beans from farmers, an expensive process that consumes the small profits he makes. He is an honest person and prays that the bank will continue to provide him and others with more services.

loans.use: To buy more coffee from farmers

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary lives outside of Kakamega town in Kakamega county. This area is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping because of the high concentration of old-growth trees and farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. Rosemary is married and has five children. She has been farming for 10 years, and is currently growing maize and vegetables on her land. She is excited to start beekeeping because it is a long-term project that she believes will have solid returns. When asked about her hopes and dreams, Rosemary said she wants to "see my children through school so that they can have a better life." This is her first loan, and she plans to use the income generated from her hives to start another small business.

loans.use: to buy beehives to begin making honey.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
For the past year Lilia, a 70-year-old married mother of 14, has been operating a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. The recipient of 19 previous loans from NWTF, she has requested a new one for PHP 16000 to buy more stocks of fruits to sell.

In the future, Lilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en: Dorcus is 40 years old, is married, and lives at Gardnersville, in Montserrado County. This is the commercial city of Liberia. She has two children, ages 15 and 23; both of them live with her, and only one is in school. Dorcus is a high school graduate, and for the past seven years she has been running a shop where she sells soft drinks, around the local market. She started this business from her husband's savings. She likes the way her customers buy from her, and the profit she generates every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks to resell at her business. She wants to build a house, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Jose Ilario

texts.es: José Ilario de  50 años de edad, casado con 6 hijos de los cuales dos están a un bajo su responsabilidad, los otros son independiente económicamente. originario de unos de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado al norte del occidente del país, zona que es muy productiva donde predomina varios tipos de negocios como la ganadería, agricultura, pesca, minas de oro, comercios, entre otros, José Ilario es propietario de un taller de ebanistería ubicado en una de las comarcas de Chinandega, él cuenta con su salario fijo de parte del minsa por sus servicios como ayudante de seguridad, realiza sus compras de materia prima en comarcas aledañas al contado y al crédito, negocio el cual tiene 27 años donde se elaboran todo tipo de muebles como: Roperos, Camas , Puertas, Cómodas y  se dan mantenimiento a muebles de madera para una posterior venta por encargo. Con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado ir aumentando su producción ya que su demanda son mayores uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar la estructura de su negocio para tener mejores condiciones y obtener mejores equipos de trabaja y así mejorar más la calidad de trabajos a sus clientes él tiene clientes fijos y eventuales da al crédito y al contado los cuales los recupera semanal y quincenal. El objetivo del préstamo es comprar 3cargas de  madera de pochote y de caoba, para terminar con unos pedidos que le encargaron, José Ilario agradece a los inversionistas kiva la ayuda que le brindan a los comerciantes pequeños de países pobres como es Nicaragua para tener un medio digno de vida
texts.en:
José Ilario, age 50, is married with six children of whom two are under his care. The others are economically independent. He is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, located in the northeast of the country. This is a very productive zone where there are several types of businesses such as livestock, agriculture, fishing, gold mines, and businesses. José Ilario owns a woodworking shop located in one of the regions of Chinandega. He has a fixed salary from Minsa, where he works as a security assistant.
He purchases his materials in the neighbouring communities on credit and in cash. He has had his business for 27 years and makes all kinds of furniture such as: wardrobes, beds, doors, and drawers. He also repairs wooden furniture for resale or on commission. With great hard work, he has been able to increase his production now that demand is greater. One of his dreams is to be able to improve his business' structure in order to have better conditions and have a better work team. This will improve the quality of his work. He has fixed clients. He sells on credit and for cash. He charges weekly or every five weeks. His goal for this loan is to buy three loads of pochote wood and mahogany. This will allow him to finish off some orders. José Ilario thanks the Kiva lenders for the help they provide owners of small businesses in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a dignified way of making a living.

loans.use: to buy basic materials such as: a load of pochote wood and two loads of mahogany in order to fill his orders.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru:
Сабохат жительница района Шахритус. Ей 57 лет. Сабохат живет вместе с мужем, сыном и внуком. Дочь Сабохат находится на заработках за рубежом. Сабохат более двенадцати лет работает поваром. В 2008 году Сабохат вместе с мужем открыла свою столовую. Она взяла в аренду помещение на центральном парке. Вот уже пять лет как Сабохат открыла столовую, где она работает поваром. На сегодняшний день у нее двое работников, которые занимаются обслуживанием клиентов. 
Сабохат берет кредит для приобретения продуктов и мебели. Она хочет поменять мебель и внести новые блюда в меню. Сабохат старается расширить свою деятельность, чтобы клиентам было приятно.
texts.en:
Sabohat is a resident of the Shahrituz region. She is 57 years old. Sabohat lives with her husband, son and grandson. Sabohat's daughter is working abroad. For more than 12 years, Sabohat has been working as a cook. In 2008, Sabohat and her husband opened their own dining room. She rented a room in the central park. It has been five years already since Sabohat opened the dining room where she works as a cook. Today, she has two employees who deal with serving customers.

Sabohat is taking a loan for the purchase of products and furniture. She wants to change the existing furniture and to put new dishes on the menu. Sabohat is trying to expand her activities in order for it to be pleasant for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase products and furniture to change the furniture and provide new dishes on the menu

loans.name: Syeda

texts.en:
Ms Syeda is a 36-year-old, married woman and mother of five children. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the past two years. She offers various goods for daily use, at reasonable prices. By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers, and she makes enough to meet the expenses of her household. Her husband also assists her in dealing with customers.
