Syeda wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000. She will use the loan to a buy stock of rice and flour from the market, at lower rates. She then would be able to satisfy the increasing demand, consistently. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses, and part to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice and flour from the market, at lower rates.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives outside of Kakamega town in western Kenya. Kakamega county is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Rose is married, and has six children and several grandchildren. She has been farming for 15 years, and is currently growing sugar cane on her land. She is interested in starting beekeeping because it is not a time-consuming activity. She wants to work with Honey Care because they buy all of their farmers' honey. 

This is Rose's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated from her hives to take care of her grandchildren and to expand her farming activities. In the future, Rose hopes to see her grandchildren though school and earn more money from her farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Akbari

texts.en:
Ms Akbari is 30 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of one child. She is a hard-working mother, who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for the past five years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000. She will use the loan to buy a stock of thread in different colors, with packs of zippers, buttons and needles, to satisfy the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors, with packs of zippers, buttons and needles, to satisfy the increasing demand.

loans.name: Nimer

texts.en: Nimer is 29 years old and from Gaza. He has owned and operated a grocery store since 2011. He asked Ryada for this Youth Loan in order to buy a refrigerator and some goods, and to install shelves for his grocery store. He hopes that this loan will increase the goods displayed and, thus, improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and some goods, and to install shelves for his grocery store.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Oscar is married, and has three children. His wife currently works as a teacher, while he farms their land. He has been farming for five years, and is currently growing sugar cane and vegetables. Oscar is excited to work with Honey Care Africa, because he enjoys the free training sessions and the chance to learn about beekeeping. He also likes beekeeping, because it is a long term project and is not time-consuming. 

This is Oscar's first loan, and he plans to use the income from his beehives to pay school fees for his children and renovate his house. When asked about his hopes and dreams for the future, Oscar said that he wants to "see my kids through university so that they can get good jobs."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 41 years old, married, and has six children. Her husband is a salesman whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Zubaida recognized the need for another source of income so she started stitching at home. She is now experienced enough to make all kinds of designs and can fulfill the demands of her customers. 

To meet the her customers’ orders on time, Zubaida is requesting her second loan for 30,000 PKR, which she will use to buy more reels of threads,  packs of buttons, laces, and zippers in various colors. She aspires to save money, which she will use to provide better facilities for her children.

loans.use: to purchase threads,  packs of button, laces, and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 31 years old and has five children. Mary Ann is married, and two of her children are in school.

Mary Ann requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF for her motorcycle transport business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her motorcycle for her business

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Ms Bashiran is 45 years old and a vigorous, married woman. She has been doing a business of gloves-sewing, for many years. She very well knows the techniques of sewing gloves. She sells them to the people of her community. She makes enough though her business. Although her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, he does not earn enough to support his family well, alone.

Ms Bashiran is a mother of three children and wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of PKR 30,000, which she will use to buy spools of wool and thread, to meet the increasing demand. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history.  She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her children.

loans.use: to buy spools of wool and thread, to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es: La Sra. Alcira, es una persona seria  humilde y dedicada,  procedente de una zona marginal, la sra. Alcira cuenta que desde pequeña era una persona muy responsable quien se quedó a cargo del cuidado de sus hermanos, mientras que su madre se dedicaba al comercio para poder solventar a su familia. La sra. Alcira con el paso del tiempo se independizo, posteriormente se casó e hizo su propia familia,   junto a su esposo  trabajo para poder solventar  a su familia, de esta manera lograron sobresalir y llevar adelante a su familia, a la actividad a la que se dedica la sra. Alcira es  la venta de llantas y transporte. La ayuda es para ampliar el  negocio  por eso acudió a la institución el cual es bonificaría del proyecto kiva, además  la Sra. Alcira es muy popular por ser muy amable lo cual le permite socializar sobre la ayuda brindada
texts.en:
Alcira is is a serious, modest and dedicated person from a poor area. Alcira says that from a young age she was a very responsible person who was left in charge of looking after her siblings while her mother sold goods to support the family. 

In time Alcira became independent, later married and started her own family, and with her husband worked to be able to support their family. In this way they managed to succeed and raise their family. The work Alcira does is selling tires and providing transportation.

The loan is for expanding her business and that is why she approached the institution, which receives funds from Kiva.  In addition. Alcira is very popular because she is very friendly, which allows her to tell her friends about the help provided.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (tires).

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
Amigas unidas es una alcancía conformada por 06 socios, uno de ellos es Gabriel joven soltero de 37 años; en la actualidad vive con su madre, en el grupo desempeña el cargo de secretario. Gabriel se dedica al oficio de la peluquería ya tiene trabajando más de 05 años, en su negocio realiza diversos servicios como cortes y tintura de cabello. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es el contacto con sus clientes  quiénes se atienden hace muchos años. Gabriel se siente muy contento por haber logrado este préstamo ya que le permitirá comprar materiales para su peluquería, su mayor sueño para el futuro es ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en una de las mejores peluquerías de su sector, para lograr esto espera seguir trabajando con EDAPROSPO y así obtener  más prestamos.
Gabriel está agradecido a las personas de todo el mundo que hacen posible su préstamo.

Gabriel viste jean celeste camisa blanca y lleva puesto una gorra.
texts.en:
Amigas Unidas is a bank made up of 6 members. One of these is Gabriel, a single 37-year-old youth. Currently, he lives with his mother. In the group he performs the duties of secretary. 

Gabriel makes a living working in a hair salon. He has worked there for more than five years. In his business, he performs a variety of services like haircuts and hair coloring. What pleases him most about his work is the contact with his customers who he has attended to for many years. 

Gabriel is very happy for having gotten this loan since it will allow him to buy materials for his salon. His greatest dream for the future is to grow his business and convert it into one of the best salons in his area. To achieve this he hopes to continue working with EDAPROSPO and so obtain more loans.

Gabriel is thankful to the people from around the world who are making this loan possible.

Gabriel is dressed in light blue jeans and a white shirt, and is wearing a hat.

loans.use: to buy materials for his hair salon.

loans.name: Kholmat

texts.ru: Человек, который всегда старается помочь нуждающимся и имеет хороший нрав, живет далеко от центра города и занимается скотоводством. Его зовут  Холмат. Ему 53 года, он женат на прекрасной женщине, которая помогает ему введение бизнеса. Климат его местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более 10 лет он занимается скотоводством. Он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у него много клиентов. Кроме жены ему помогает его сыновья.  Холмат хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  2000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода он собирается обеспечить семью с хорошим условием. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
This man, who always tries to help those in need and has a good disposition, lives far from the city center and is engaged in raising cattle. His name is Kholmat. He is 53 years old. He is married to a beautiful woman who is helping him in running the business. The climate of his place of residence is very favorable for cultivating crops and raising livestock. For more than ten years, he has been engaged in raising cattle. He sells cattle which he has tended for a number of months. The market has many customers. Beside his wife, he is helped also by his sons. 

Kholmat wants to grow his business, but does not have sufficient funds to do so.He is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni for the purchase of cattle to develop his business. With the income received, he is going to provide good conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle

loans.name: Sarvar

texts.ru: Сарвар является повторным клиентом и кредитуется 7 цикл. Он очень честный и аккуратный человек. Сарвар имеет хорошее понимание кредитования и поэтому имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Сарвару 34 года. Он женат. Его жена помогает ему введение бизнеса, так как он более 10 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры как картошка, пшеница и т.д. Сарвар имеет большой опыт и благодаря упорному труду он справляется с бизнесом отлично. Он имеет много клиентов на местном рынке, которые покупают его продукцию. Сарвар планирует сделать посев, но не имеет денег для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 8000 сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Этот займ поможет ему развевать бизнес и таким образом получать больше дохода. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sarvar is a returning client on his seventh loan cycle. He is a very honest and tidy person. Sarvar has a good understanding of borrowing and therefore has a good credit history. 

Sarvar is 34 years old. He is married. His wife helps him in running the business, as he has for more than ten years been engaged in cultivating crops such as potatoes, wheat, etc. Sarvar has a lot of experience and thanks to hard work he deals with the business in an excellent manner. He has many customers in the local market who buy his products. 

Sarvar plans to grow a crop, but has no money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. He is asking for a loan of 8,000 somoni to buy seeds and fertilizer. This loan will help him to develop the business and in this way generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for land where he grows potatoes and wheat

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher lives outside of Kakamega town, which is in Kakamega county in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. This area contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Christopher is married and has five children. He has been farming for 10 years, and is currently growing sugar cane and vegetables on his land. He is excited to start beekeeping because the bees do all the work and you don't have to worry about caring for them or feeding them. This is Christopher's first loan, and he plans to use the income he earns to pay college fees for his children and to buy fertilizers for his crops. When asked about his hopes and dreams for the future, Christopher said that he wants to "build a good house for my family."

loans.use: to buy beehives to make honey.

loans.name: Musrat

texts.en:
Ms. Musrat is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three. Her husband is a school teacher. She has been in business of stitching for eight years to support her husband. She has accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household and the educational needs of children. That is why she started stitching clothes at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. 

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she requested for a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, and laces in various colors. In this way, she will be able to meet with the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Musrat hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en:
Ms Shakila is a 38-year-old, married woman. She has been running a business, selling children's clothes, for many years. She purchases a variety of children's clothes from the main city, and then sells the clothes to the people of her vicinity. By this time, she has become famous for selling good-quality clothing in her community.

Shakila requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She will use it to buy a stock of different children's clothes for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to increase her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more income. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children, through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different children's clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Babara

texts.en: Babara is 43 years old and lives in Montrserrado County, which is located in the part of Liberia which catches the largest amount of fish. She is married and the mother of five children between 20 to 29 years of age, only one of whom still lives at home and attends school. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling charcoal in the local market. She learned this trade from her friends and started this business with help provided by her mother. She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal to sell. Her goal for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Ms. Naseem is a 53-year-old married woman who has had a business of selling milk for the past five years. She has two cows in milk; she sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to enable her to lead her decent life. She is a mother of two children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.  It’s her first year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. She applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase another cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash. According to Naseem, Kashf Foundation changed her whole life by providing financial support and also providing awareness and improved decision-making power through training sessions.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Ms Safia is a 38-year-old, married woman, who is living with her husband and four children in Punjab, Pakistan. For about four years she has been in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. She specially designs wedding dresses. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000. She will use it to buy spools of thread in different colors, and packs of beads, sequins and stones, for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers, consistently. She is hoping to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Safia dreams of her children's bright future, and she desires to build her own outlet. She is very much thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones, for embellishment.

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en: Majeedan is a 53-year-old married woman who has had a business in carpet manufacturing for many years. She offers various handmade carpets and has become famous in her circle for providing good quality products. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family. She is the mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing and education. She is also doing sewing as her part time job. In this way she is able to handle her family needs and requirements effectively. It’s her first year with Kashf Foundation and she is satisfied with the support of it. Currently she applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales and hence better support her family.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Ms. Rukhsana is  33 years old, married and the mother of four children. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past 10 years, has earned a living by running a clothing business with the support of her husband. We see him here in the photo. She buys clothing made from lots of different fabrics and colors, and designs and sells it to people who live in her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough money to help support her family. Rukhsana is requesting a loan for Rs. 20,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothing in different colors and designs to attract more customers. She expects a boost in her earnings from this loan and plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothing in different colors and designs to attract more customers.

loans.name: Allah-Wasai

texts.en: Ms Allah-Wasai is 48 years old, married and has earned a living by buying and selling animals for many years now. She grew up in a farming family, and that is how she became an expert at raising cattle. She buys baby goats and cows at low prices and raises them so her husband can sell them in the local market for a higher price. She has gradually improved her business with help from the Kashf Foundation. She is requesting a new loan for Rs. 35,000 to buy two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a high-quality education to her children by working hard.

loans.use: to buy two more goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rainforest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugarcane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest and the variety of crops grown in the area make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Henry is married and has seven children. Both he and his wife have been farming for thirteen years, and are currently growing beans, maize and sweet potatoes. Henry is excited to work with Honey Care because they conduct hive inspections every month. 

This is Henry's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated from his hives to help provide the basic needs of his family, including food, clothing and school fees. In the future, Henry hopes to "buy a big farm and do more farming."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 36 years old, married, and has one child. He operates a public address business and also offers DJ services, which he has been doing for 12 years. He earns 35,000 KES a month.

Alex is requesting his fourth loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy a pro DJ player from Dubai. In future he wants to be a very famous DJ.

loans.use: to purchase a pro DJ player

loans.name: Joe's Group

texts.en:
Joe's Group is made up of three traders who are in the sales of cement, bed sheets, wigs, cream, and yams. The members include Joseph, Victoria, and Rosemary.

Joseph is 43 years old. He is an energetic and cheerful person. He is married and has three children. His wife Rosemary sells yams. For years, he has been involved in the sale and supply of cement and bed sheet to the people of Teshie. The building and renovation of houses in Teshie is very high which makes this business very lucrative to Joseph. He wants to develop his business and thus increase revenue. He plans to use the income to invest in his children's education. 

He is asking for a loan to buy cements and bed sheets to sell to customers.

They need a total amount of 1,100 GHS to be able to buy enough goods and sell to customers.

loans.use: To  buy cement and bed sheets to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 32 years old and has four children. Nilda is married, and three of her children are in school.

Nilda has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Nilda requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to  purchase spare parts to maintain the good condition of her motorcycle.

Nilda has been in business for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain the good condition of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is an unmarried lady who is doing a business of making laces, to provide for her family. Previously, she took a loan to purchase raw material, e.g., cloth, ribbons, thread, artificial pearls, etc. for making new styles of laces which are used on clothes. 

Currently she has applied for her second loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase more material, such as ribbons, pearls, and bundles of cloth in different colors, to inflate her sales.  By this time, she has maintained a good list of customers and she makes enough money to contribute to the family income. 

Nazia dreams to expand her business, to provide financial support and stability to her family members. She is thankful to Kashf Foundation and Kiva for their tremendous support.

loans.use: to purchase more material, such as ribbon, laces, and bundles of cloth in different colors, to make laces for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 48 years old, single, and lives in Gardnerville in Montserrado County which is the commercial city of Liberia with her five children. Only one of her children is in school. She stopped her education in the fifth grade. Since 1992, she has been running a table market where she sells pepper, vita, salt, onion, palm oil, and other items in the local market. She started this business from her savings at the time. When she started, she was selling shortbread. She likes the ways her customers buy from her and the profit she generates each day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business. In the near future, she wants to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Ms. Sharifa is a 41-year-old married woman. Her husband has been running a business of milk trading in their community for the last three years. The man shown in the photo is Sharifa’s husband. She helps her husband by caring the cattle and their food arrangements. They make enough to fulfill the demands of their three children. Sharifa got information from her neighbors and put in an application to get a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to expand the family's milk business. In this way, she would be able to cater more of the people of her community.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to expand her milk business.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of foliage. 

Harrison is married and has seven children. He has been farming for 25 years and is currently growing maize, beans, sweet potatoes, cassava, and vegetables on his land. He is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper because "it is well paid, and the bees take care of themselves."

This is Harrison's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated from his hives to feed his family and pay his children's school fees. In the future, Harrison hopes to expand his land, so that his family has enough room to live on.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 53 years old, married, and has seven children. She sells cashew nuts in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She also earns additional income from selling rice.

Vilma is requesting a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional cashew nuts to sell.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Ms. Nusrat is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She offers various items for daily use and earns enough to contribute to the family income. Nusrat has taken various loans from Kashf foundation to enhance her business, and now she is earning reasonable profit from her business. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. Currently she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Asyia

texts.en: Ms. Asyia has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide her family for many years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. Five years ago she borrowed from Kashf for the first time to purchase raw materials. Now she has requested another loan worth 30,000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads, sequins, and beads in various colors. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Asyia has taken up. She has four children and wants to provide them a quality education for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, sequins, and beads in various colors.

loans.name: Hamidi

texts.en: Hamidi is a 48-year-old widowed woman from Lebanon. She is living with her five children. Three are attending school and the others are working. In 2011, and in order to supplement the family’s income, she decided to start her own work as a farmer. Her job consists of cultivating fruits and vegetables. She sells these goods to her customers from all over the neighboring areas. Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a big refrigerator where she can keep her products in good condition. She states that the loan will certainly help her increase her business productivity by a fair percentage which will return higher profits to her. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and expand her lands by cultivating a wider variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase a big refrigerator where she can keep her products in good conditions

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is 24 years old and single. He lives with his parents and one sibling. He is a painter with many years of experience. He works on different projects and always tries to offer his customers the best results he can. He is known for being punctual and well-organized. 

Bilal is requesting a youth loan from Vitas s.a.l, which he will use to purchase an electrical generator for his business. He will be utilizing the loan to facilitate and carry on his work in a proper way. In the near future, he looks to take more projects possibly outside the country if this will help him learn new designs and better develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator for his business.

loans.name: Luir Roberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 47 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su , vive al lado de su esposa y producto de la unión entr ambos tienen 3 hijos de 21,8 y 9 años de edad, por los cuales trabaja con mucha fuerza ya que para el son lo mas grande que tiene en la vida y por ello se sacrifica y esfuerza para poder ofrecerles un futuro mejor. Desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, por ello lamentablemente no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día; en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos y noticieros en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Parihuela para compartir con su familia. 

Con mucho entusiasmo Luis trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de pescados, Luis e levanta muy temprano y recorre las calles de la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos él cuenta con un pequeño tricimoto, en el cual todas las mañanas sale a realizar sus ventas por diversas calles; adicionalmente Luis trabaja por las noches como vigilante de un centro educativo de su distrito, él trabaja en su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor.

Luis esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar útiles escolares para sus menores hijos, ya que las cases ya iniciaron y aun no tienen los materiales completos; de esta manera podrá mejorar la educación y bienestar de sus pequeños hijos, ya que sueña con verlos convertirse en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Luis is 47 years old and lives with his wife in the city of Ica, within the Santiago district.  They have three children, ages 21,8, and 9, for whom he works hard; for him they are the greatest thing he has in his life and sacrifices himself so that they will have a better future.  He had to go to work to help support his parents when he was very young and unfortunately was not able to complete his secondary education, but he hopes to do it one day.  He likes to watch educational television shows and news in his spare time and sometimes cooks a delicious Parihuela to share with his family.

Luis works his small fish selling business with great enthusiasm.  He rises very early and travels the city streets offering his products on his motorized tricycle.  He also works nights as a security guard at a school in his district.  He works about 12 hours in his business and he is comfortable getting his work done.

Luis is grateful to the Kiva lenders and thanks to the help they give, he will be able to buy school supplies for his children, now that classes have started and they don’t have all of their supplies.  In this way he can improve their education and wellbeing.  He dreams of seeing them become good professionals and men of means.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna is a friendly and kind woman. She’s from Lebanon and is 31 years old. She got married a short while ago and has three children. She lives with her husband, who serves in the Lebanese army. They are working really hard to provide the family with the needed income.  And since she noticed that their income does not satisfy their needs, she decided to launch her clothing business.

She sells a wide variety of new and used clothes, from which she earns a fair amount of money daily. She also sells shoes. To better develop her work, she’s requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more merchandise for the coming season, such as pants, t-shirts, and many other items. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and, thus, will improve her income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for the coming season, such as pants, t-shirts, and many other items

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years, now.

Amy requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy motorcycle parts, for the maintenance of her motorcycle business. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, in the future.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts, for the maintenance of her motorcycle business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase timber to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas, and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old-growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Mary is married and has eight children. She is involved in a variety of farming activities and is currently raising dairy cows, keeping traditional log beehives, and growing maize, beans, and other vegetables. She likes beekeeping because it is not very time-consuming, which is important given how busy she is on her farm. 

This is Mary's first loan and she hopes to use the income she gains from her beehives to help her pay college fees for her children. In the future, Mary hopes to "earn more money from my farming and buy more land."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 47 years old and a resident of Rubaga Road. She is a hard-working, honest and cooperative lady. She is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She takes care of two additional dependents, because their parents passed away.

Juliet operates a boutique that is situated in Kampala town, mainly dealing in ladies' clothes. Juliet has been looking after her sister’s children ever since the parents died, and she has been able to educate them; one of them has joined University. However, University fees are high. Juliet therefore needs a loan to pay tuition, since she does not have the entire tuition and functional fees.

loans.use: To pay tuition and fees for her niece, whom she has raised

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell dairy products

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well-suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Nicholas is married, and has seven children. He has been farming for thirty years, and is currently growing maize and vegetables on his land. He is excited to start beekeeping because "it is a long-term project, and it is cheap compared to other projects."

This is Nicholas' first loan, and he plans to use the income generated from his hives to help educate his children, and to expand his farming activities. In the future, Nicholas hopes to save up enough money to "build a good and comfortable house for my family."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BENKADI  est constitué de 5 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait  l’achat vente de condiments  à l’image de TIMA,  la seule assise sur la photo.  
Elle  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 cartons de cube Maggi, 4 sacs d’oignons avec les grossistes de Sikasso.  Elle effectue ses ventes au marché, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is composed of five married women who are on average 44 years old with three children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers and sons in the Massablacoura quarter of Bougouni.
They met through neighbourhood, friendship and business contacts. To reinforce their financial capacity in order to do better business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution and this is their third loan. The two previous loans were repaid correctly. This group of women buy and sell condiments like Tima, the only one sitting in the photo.
With her loan she plans to buy two boxes of Maggi cubes and four sacks of onions from the wholesalers in Sikasso. She sells her merchandise at the market retail for cash or credit to an essentially female clientele.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 45.000FCFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  DANAYA   est constitué de 4 femmes mariées  et  1 veuve ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième cycle. Les  2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tissus
à l’image de  FATOUMATA,  qui est la seule assise sur la photo. Elle fait l’achat vente de pagnes et tissus et compte acheter avec son  prêt,   20 pièces de pagnes wax avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of four married women and one widow. They live in extended traditional families in the Massablacoura quarter of Bougouni.
They met through neighbourhood, friendship and business contacts. To increase their financial capacity and do better business, they have become members of the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution and this is their third loan. They repaid the two previous loans correctly. This group of women deal in textiles like Fatoumata, the one sitting in the photo. She buys and sells traditional pagne fabrics and plans to purchase with her loan 20 wax pagnes from the wholesalers in Bamako. She sells her merchandise at the market and from her home for cash or for credit to an essentially female clientele.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 60.000FCFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy pagne fabrics.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra es una señora muy emprendedora, vive con su esposo quien es discapacitado y por lo tanto el sustento de ambos depende de los ingresos que obtenidos por medio del negocio de soda (venta de comidas) que ella tiene, gracias al buen trato y a la variedad de platillos que ofrece ha conseguido que la clientela esté aumentado, debido a esto Mayra requiere comprar más utensilios de cocina, necesita también sillas, mesas y pintar y rotular el local para brindarle un mejor servicio al cliente, para esto solicita un millón de colones exactos (¢1.000.000). Ella manifiesta su gran satisfacción por la oprotunidad que le ofrece el crédito de apoyo comunal.
texts.en: Mayra is a very hard-working person. She lives with her husband, who is handicapped. Their livelihood depends on the income she derives from her shop, where she serves food. Thanks to her amiability towards customers and the variety of dishes on offer, more and more people are coming to eat at her shop. Mayra therefore needs to buy more kitchen utensils, chairs, and tables. The shop could also use a new coat of paint and a sign above the door, in order to enhance customer experience. For all these renovations, Mayra needs exactly one million colones. She is very happy about the opportunities afforded to her by the communal bank and its loans.

loans.use: to renovate her shop, where she serves food.

loans.name: Unión Y Progreso 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN Y PROGRESO 2”  iniciará el vigésimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ximena es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carteras de cuero, costura de prendas de cuero, venta de comida, elaboración de duraznos deshidratados, venta de velas, confección y venta de mantas, taller de chapería, venta de joyas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ximena es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección y venta de carteras de cuero; que inicia por iniciativa de su madre, que vendía folders de cuero; posteriormente ella inicia su propio espacio de costura.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina de coser) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en la frontera de Bolivia y Perú. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el buen trato, las reuniones con las compañeras y la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The UNIÓN Y PROGRESO 2 communal bank will begin its 24th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo center.  It’s made up of nine members and directed by a board of directors where Ximena serves as the treasure.  The businesses that the members have include leather wallet sales, leather clothing, food sales, dried peaches, candles, making and selling blankets, body shops, and jewelry sales.

This loan will help their small businesses, including Ximena’s, who has been working with Pro Mujer for eight years.  She joined on the invitation of her sister in law who is a member.  She has a leather wallet manufacture and sales business that her mother started and who sold leather goods.  She later started her own sewing business.

She will use the money from this loan to increase her working capital (buy a sewing machine).  She will buy it at a fair in El Alto and the begin manufacturing along the Bolivia-Peru border.  This type of work will allow her to generate income to support her household.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the good treatment, meetings with her fellow members, and health care.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Los Jardines Group

texts.es:
ISABEL SUSANA, tiene 37 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene 5 hijos. Ella es socia del grupo "Los Jardines" formado por seis integrantes, cada uno de ellos con diferentes negocios pero con el mismo deseo de salir adelante mediante el trabajo.
Hace aproximadamente 8 años inició su negocio de venta de cebiche de pota, ella ubica su negocio a la salida de un colegio, donde sus principales consumidores son los estudiantes. Gracias a este negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, sobretodo al menor que apenas tiene 3 añitos.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la venta de cebiche
texts.en: Isabel Susana is 37 years old. She is divorced and has five children. She is a member of Los Jardines group (the name means 'the gardens'), which has five other members. No two members work in the same trade, but they all share a strong will to get ahead in life through their hard work. Isabel has been selling ceviche (raw fish prepared the traditional way) for about eight years. Her stall is located near a secondary school, so the students make up most of her customer base. Thanks to her business, she was able to provide for her children, particularly for her youngest son, who is only three years old. Isabel will use the loan to buy the ingredients needed to make ceviche.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed to make ceviche.

loans.name: Ladylyn

texts.en:
Ladylyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Ladylyn requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ladylyn has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives outside of Kakamega town, Kenya, which is famous for its rain forest.  Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane, and bananas, with maize being the primary crop.  This is an excellent area for beekeeping due to the density of old trees in the Kakamega forest and the variety of crops grown in the area.

Simon has been farming for forty years.  He is currently growing sweet potatoes, cassava, and palm trees on his land.  He is also tending to dairy cows.  Simon likes beekeeping because it is a cheap, manageable activity.

This is Simon's first loan.  He plans to use the income generated from his beehives to help buy medicine for his wife, who is sick.  In the future, Simon hopes to earn enough from his farming activities so that he can take good care of his wife.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 32-year-old man from Nakuru.  He is married to Christine and they have two children, ages eight and three years old.

Amos has been in the transportation business for the past two years.  He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying his previous loans.  He wishes to use the loan amount to buy a motor bike.  He hopes to own a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. 

Daniel is married, and has three children. His wife works as a "business lady" while Daniel farms. He has been farming for 30 years and is currently growing maize, beans, and bananas on his land. He is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper because beekeeping is not a time consuming activity and will let him focus on other parts of his farm.

This is Daniel's first loan and he plans to use the income from his beehives to buy food for his cows, buy more beehives, and purchase some farm tools. When asked about his hopes and dreams for the future, Daniel said he hopes that his children "get jobs, so that my grandchildren can have a good life."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Del Oriente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS MARGARITAS DEL ORIENTE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por seis  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de helados, vende condimentos y pela ajo.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás, cuando ingresa a trabajar en una pensión (venta de comida), actualmente ya tiene su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite y fideo) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud.
texts.en: Communal bank 'Las Margaritas del Oriente' (the name means 'Marguerites of the East') is starting its first cycle with field partner Pro Mujer, in the framework of the focus centre of Panamericana. It has six members and an executive board, with Justina as president. The members of the group are engaged in various activities, among them food sales, ice-cream sales, and spices and peeled garlic sales. This loan will thus benefit a group of very small entrepreneurs, among them Justina. She tells us that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer. She got to know the field partner thanks to a spokesperson, who came to visit her at her house. Justina operates a food stall, as she learned cooking many years ago, when she was working in a restaurant. She now has her own business. She will use this loan to increase her working capital and buy rice, cooking oil, and pasta from the markets of El Alto. She will then prepare food to sell from her stall. The income Justina derives from her business enables her to help with household expenses, since she is married and has two children. When asked what she likes about working with Pro Mujer, she talks about health care.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, and pasta.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 3 years and she works hard to support her family.

Lorna requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy necessary items for repairing her fishing boat (nets, paint, wood, etc.).  In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 56 years old and married to David, who contributes to the family income. They have five children who still depend on them. She has been operating her retail shop for a period of about 13 years with an income of approximately KES 30,000 a month.

This is her fifth loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use the loan to buy rice, sugar, soap, shoe polish, and toothpaste in bulk to stock her business. She hopes to be a leading businesswoman in the region.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, soap, shoe polish, and toothpaste in bulk to stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera is a resident of the Mariakani area of the Coast province in Kenya. She owns a food business which deals in selling of fish. She has been in the business for five years. She is a married mother of seven children.

Bendera was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to purchase fish for sale. The challenge that the business faces is high transport and price fluctuations.

She will use the extra income from the loan to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy fish for sale.

loans.name: Carolina Lisett

texts.es:
Doña Carolina, reside en la capital del folklore nicaragüense, Masaya, ella es viuda, comerciante, tiene la edad de 48 años, su núcleo familiar lo conforman ella y su tres hijos. 

Su negocio consiste en la elaboración y venta de enchiladas y tacos en el mercado, posee su negocio desde  hace dos años y medios, el cual ha sido su medio de subsistencia, debido a que el apoyo con que contaba la dejo de tener al fallecer su esposo y se vio en la necesidad de salir adelante y gracias a eso ha sacado adelante a su familia junto con su hija. 

Doña Carolina es una ama de casa, persona honrada y trabajadora que conoce el valor de ser independiente, su día de trabajo comienza al levantarse a la tres de la mañana a  elaborar las enchiladas y tacos,  junto con su hija mayor que le ayuda,  para estar lista a las ocho de la mañana que es cuando sale a su puesto de trabajo a vender, posterior cuando ella termina la mercadería del día se regresa a su hogar para cuidar de sus hijos mas pequeños. Comenta que comenzó el negocio con capital propio, las ventas que realiza son de contado y sus clientes son transeúntes del mercado.

Actualmente  tiene la necesidad de reparar su cocina, que con el pasar del tiempo se le a deteriorado la infraestructura, por tal razón requiere de un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción para el mejoramiento de su cocina, y del que es su medio de trabajo porque es ahí donde  elabora sus alimentos diario de su familia como los de su negocio como son tacos y enchiladas.

 Solicita el crédito para la compra de  arena, piedrín, cemento blanco, y mano de obra, de tal manera que le de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carolina lives in the capital of Nicaraguan folklore, Masaya. She is a widow and a saleswoman. She is 48 years old and and has three children. 

Her business consists of making and selling enchiladas and tacos in the market. She has had the business for two and a half years. It has been her means of support, since she lost the income of her husband when he died, and she had to move forward. Thanks to her business she has brought her family forward, together with her daughter.  

Mrs. Carolina is a homemaker, an honorable and hard-working person who knows the value of being independent. Her work day starts when she gets up at three in the morning to make enchiladas and tacos, together with her oldest daughter who helps her. They have to be ready at eight in the morning, which is when she leaves her workplace to begin selling. Later, when she finishes her day at the market, Mrs. Carolina returns home to care for her younger children. She started the business with her own money. Her sales are in cash, and her clients are the people who pass by in the market. 

Currently, she needs to repair her kitchen. The infrastructure has deteriorated as time passed. For this reason, she needs the loan to buy construction materials to repair her kitchen, which is her means of work because it is where she makes the daily food for her family as well as the tacos and enchiladas for her business.  

She is requesting the loan to buy sand, stone, white cement, and labor. In this way she will improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sand, white cement, stone and labor.

loans.name: Santos Luis

texts.es:
El Señor Santos  de 63  años, vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 04 años a la venta de material  como ser arena y tierra para adobes etc.
Don Santos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa y sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan
Don Santos está solicitando el préstamo para compra de arena y tierra, porque tiene que entregar unos pedidos de material.  Con el apoyo de este préstamo el pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio y  de igual forma mejorar sus ingresos.
Don Santos su sueño es comprarse más maquinarias para sacar material.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Santos, 63, lives with his wife in his house located in the San Lorenzo community in the southern part of Honduras. 

For the past four years he has sold materials such as sand and soil for bricks etc. 

Santos's business is located in his house and his clients are neighbors and friends who visit him daily. 

Santos is asking for a loan to buy sand and soil because he has to deliver some orders. 

With the help of this loan he will be able to finance his business and improve his income. 

His dream is to buy equipment that will extract sand and soil.  

 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2013

loans.use: to buy sand and soil for his business.

loans.name: Tapitha

texts.en:
Tapitha is a 24-year-old single businesswomen. She has been selling new clothes in her shop for a period of about three years with an income of approximately KES 18,000 a month.

She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use the loan to buy more clothes in bulk and sell them. 

The loan she was advanced has helped her boost her business and she  has increased her profits. She hopes to build her own house and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more clothes in bulk and sell them.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in the Likoni district of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three school-going children. She owns a grocery shop--a business which has been running for one year. In the business, she sells foodstuffs, household goods, etc. She also sells charcoal. She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are inflation and bad debts.

Grace is applying for a loan of 74,450 Kenyan shillings to buy retail stock e.g. maize, beans, rice and cooking fat. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve upon the living standard of her family and pay school fees for her children. She aspires to open a mini wholesale store.

loans.use: To buy retail stock e.g. maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Anne is married, and has three children. Both she and her husband have been farming for more than 20 years. Anne is currently tending dairy cows, raising poultry and growing vegetables on her land. She is excited to start beekeeping for two main reasons: the bees do all of the work, and she loves eating honey.

This is Anne's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to buy even more hives. In the future, Anne hopes to see her grandchildren "grow up well."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to machinery and materials

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of three school-going children. She runs a clothes shop which has been operating for two years. She employs one person in the business. She also runs a pool machine from which customers play the pool table games.

Janet was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 52,250 Kenyan shillings to purchase a new pool table.

Janet believes the income from this loan will help her educate her children. As well, she is focused on owning a wholesale shop despite the challenge of the high cost of stocks from suppliers making most of her items beyond the public's reach.

loans.use: To purchase a new pool table.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Luisa Ercilia

texts.es: Doña luisa, madre de tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad y trabajadores, es un gran orgullo  que tiene ella y su esposo porque de manera humilde, pero han sabido encaminar a sus hijos quienes la apoyan incondicionalmente, doña luisa siempre se dedica a su negocio la venta de comida y obtiene el apoyo de su esposo quien ahora es jubilado, su meta es seguir manteniendo el mismo ritmo de trabajo ya que es su único medio de ingresos, que le ayuda a sufragar los diferentes gastos del hogar, por eso solicita este crédito para invertir con mas productos de carnes, granos básicos, verduras y frutas para los refrescos.
texts.en: Luisa is the mother of three adult, hardworking children, who she and her husband are very proud of.  They raised them humbly but they support them unconditionally.  Luisa sells food and has her husband’s support.  He is retired now.  Her goal is to continue this work routine because it’s her only source of income and it helps her pay the various household expenses.  She is asking for this loan so that she can buy more products, such as meats, basic grains, vegetables, and fruits for her drinks.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: San Martin De Porres Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria del Rosario, tiene 45 años de edad, forma parte del grupo "San Martin de Porres" integrado por 6 socios.
María del Rosario, hace cinco años inició su negocio de venta de comida, el cual realiza todos los días, prepara sus alimentos en su casa y luego lo reparte a domicilio o de lo contrario se contacta con trabajadores de obras y construcciones y les lleva la comida.
Su negocio va creciendo poco a poco y le ayuda a solventar los gastos familiares.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos, estos insumos los podrá comprar a precio por mayor para que le cueste menos y así pueda obtener mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Maria del Rosario is 45 years old and a member of the “San Martin de Porres” group, made up of six members.

Maria del Rosario started a food business five years ago and works it daily.  She makes the food at her home and then delivers it to her customers’ homes or gets in touch with laborers and construction workers and takes food to them.

Her business has been growing little by little and it helps her pay her family expenses.

She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients for her food.  This will allow her to buy them at bulk prices, so it will cost her less and she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Minor

texts.es:
Minor es un joven que se dedica a varias labores comerciales entre ellas la entrega de gas propano a domicilio, él ha formado una importante clientela y ya necesita de un medio de transporte para hacer dichas entregas, además de ofrecer este servicio en su propia comunidad también quiere expanderse a otras poblaciones cercanas . Está solicitando un millón de colones exactos (¢1.000.000) para adquirir una motocicleta y trasladar el producto a los diferentes lugares.
Minor se siente complacido de contar con este financiamiento que le ayudará según sus palabras a lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Minor is a young man who does several different things.  Among them is home delivery of propane gas.  He has important customers and needs a means of transportation to make his deliveries.  Aside from this service in his own community, he wants to expand to other nearby areas.  He is asking for a loan of a million colones (¢1.000.000) to buy a motorcycle to be able to travel to different areas.

Minor feels completed by this loan that will help him achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Minor

texts.es: Minor es padre de tres hijos, vive en el pacífico sur del país, su negocio consiste en  distribuir gas profano en los locales comerciales que se dedican a la  venta de productos de consumo diario. El cuenta con una gran cantidad de cilindros (recipientes) que lleva a la compañia de gas para recargarlos e iniciar su distribución. Para comprar más líquido y aumentar su clientela necesita un crédito de un millón de oolones (¢1.000.000), con esto logrará atender más comedrcio y por supuesto incrementasr sus ingresos.
texts.en: Minor is the father of three children and lives in the southern part of the country.  He delivers propane gas to merchants who sell food.  He has many cylinders that he takes to the gas company to be recharged and distributed.  He needs a loan of one million colones (¢1.000.000) in order to buy more liquefied gas so he can increase his customers.  This way he can make more sales and, of course, increase his income.

loans.use: to buy propane.

loans.name: Reza

texts.en:
My name is Reza and I come from a family of two siblings: a brother in high school and a younger sister in kindergarten.  Currently I am in my third year, studying BBS-Actuarial Science in the School of Finance and Applied Economics at Strathmore University. I am pursuing a career as an actuary and my grades so far have been good. I am applying for the Kiva loan so as to complete the two remaining years of my Bachelor's degree.

My parents are struggling to meet the fees for me and my brother in secondary school because they both don't earn enough, but would like to see me get a quality university education given by Strathmore. 

The Kiva loan repayment is friendly because it spreads the repayment out over a longer period, compared to the three installments required by Strathmore University for every year of a degree. The KIVA loan would assist me greatly in paying my tuition fees over the remaining academic years of my course. This would enable me to study hard and go through the course without missing any classes or exams because of unpaid fees.  I appreciate Strathmore University for all the assistance I have received in applying for this loan.

I commit to paying back the loan on time and to give back in the future to other needy cases so as to continue the spirit initiated by Kiva.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees in order to complete an undergraduate course in Bachelor of  Business Science in Actuarial Science.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es:
Ángela de 48 años de edad, es ama de casa y madre de dos hijos. Los cuales son su mayor prioridad y la razón de su existencia. Toda la vida se dedicó a cuidar de su familia mientras su esposo generaba la provisión para el hogar. Desde hace varios meses decidió colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Comenzó vendiendo productos por catálogo, actividad que le ha generado buena rentabilidad, por lo cual aún continua ejerciéndola. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza y pijamas con el fin de aumentar sus ventas.
Espera que con dicha inversión genere los ingresos suficientes para ingresar a su hijo menor a la universidad.
texts.en:
Angela is 48 years old and is a housewife with two children, and they are her main priority and reason for living.  All her life she has decided to care for her family while her husband generated the household income.  A few months ago she decided to help her husband with the expenses and improve the family’s quality of life.  She started selling products via catalog, which has provided good profits so she continues to do it.  She is asking for a loan to buy beauty products and pajamas so she can increase her sales.

She hopes that this investment will generate the income needed to sign her youngest son up for university.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin de 25 años de edad, se ha dedicado a las labores agrícolas desde su infancia, asegura que el campo es su mejor paraíso. Desde niño aprendió de la actividad gracias a su padre y tíos. Se dedica a la siembra de cultivos de yuca, ñame y maíz, labor que realiza diariamente de seis de la mañana a una de la tarde. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de cerdos con el fin de alternar las dos actividades y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá garantizarle a su esposa y a sus tres hijas menores de una mejor calidad de vida y una vivienda digna.
texts.en: Edwin is 25 years old and has been farming since he was a boy.  He says that the fields are his greatest paradise and learned this activity when he was a boy, thanks to his father and his uncles.  He raises yucca, yams, and corn and works every day from six in the morning to one in the afternoon.  He is asking for a loan to buy pigs so that he can diversify his activities into two and increase his income.  This will allow him to guarantee a better quality and dignified life to his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene de 61 años de edad es una emprendedora quien inició su propio negocio con el fin de generar una fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento y la educación de su hijo, debido a su condición de madre soltera. 
Irene se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo desde hace más de diez años, actividad que realiza desde su vivienda. Hoy se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía, con el propósito de aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y cumplir su sueño de tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Irene is 61 years old and an entrepreneur who started her own business in order to create a source of income to support her son’s education.  She is a single mother.

Irene sells catalog via catalog and has for ten years.  She works out of her home and is asking for a loan so that she can buy merchandise so she can increase her sales and generate greater income.  This will allow her to improve her quality of life and achieve her dream of having her own store.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Lilia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lilia del Socorro de 45 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mercancía especialmente insumos para la confección en diferentes municipios de Antioquia, Colombia. Laboró con su padre en el desarrollo de la actividad y hace unos meses falleció por lo cual Lilia se hizo cargo del negocio. 
Asegura que las ventas siempre le han llamado la atención, y después de separarse de su cónyuge y con un hijo que sostener decidió pedirle empleo a su padre. Hoy el negocio le corresponde por herencia, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de de telas con el fin de satisfacer la demanda. 
Espera que con dicho préstamo pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y brindarle a su hijo la oportunidad e ingresar a la educación superior.
texts.en:
Lila de Socorro is 45 years old and sells clothes making supplies in different neighborhoods in Antioquia, Colombia.  She worked with her father in developing the business but he passed away a few months ago.  This left Lilia in charge of the business.

She says that she has always been attracted to sales and after having separated from her husband and having a son to support, she decided to ask her father for work.  Now that she has inherited the business, she is asking for a loan so she can buy fabric to satisfy her customer demand. 

She expects that this loan will allow her to improve her family’s quality of life and provide her son the opportunity to begin a higher education.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: María Nubia

texts.es:
Nubia de 49 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa  y productos Amway a familiares, amigos y conocidos, este negocio surgió gracias su gran pasión por la moda y las ventas. Actualmente, Nubia labora sola y con su amabilidad y alegría ha logrado fidelizar a sus clientes. Con el ánimo de seguir con su negocio, verlo crecer y cumplir con los pedidos solicitados, requiere de la compra de mercancía y productos de belleza Amway, artículos que le permitirán satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar. 
En un futuro próximo, Nubia desea tener su propio almacén y apoyar a sus dos hijos menores para que accedan a la educación superior.
texts.en:
Nubia is 49 years old and sells clothing and Amway products to family, friends, and acquaintances.  This business began thanks to a great passion for fashion and sales.  Currently, Nubia works alone and her happiness and friendliness has allowed her to gain faithful customers.  With a desire to get ahead and continue with her business, watch it grow, and meet her customer demands, she needs to buy merchandise and Amway beauty products.  This will allow her to satisfy her household needs.

In the future, Nubia wants to have her own store and support her two children obtain a higher education.

loans.use: to buy clothing and beauty products.

loans.name: Ana Sagrario

texts.es: Ana, tiene 54 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes junto a su esposo y una nieta. Ana lleva 10 años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de comidas y refrescos, vende desayunos, almuerzos y comidas rápidas como pastelitos, baleadas, tajadas con carne etc.. El negocio lo tiene establecido en el mercado local. Ha obtenido 19 ciclos de prestamos con ODEF con los cuales a podido mantener estable su negocio. Actualmente esta solicitando otro por 10,000 lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de insumos como carnes, refrescos, condimentos,verduras etc.para la elaboración de comidas y en refrescos para la venta. Su meta es tener siempre una estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Ana is 54 years old, in a common law marriage, has four children, and lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes with her husband and a granddaughter.  She has been making and selling food and drinks for ten years.  She sells breakfasts, lunches, and fast food such as meat pies, baleadas, sliced meat, etc.  Her business is at a local market.  She has had 19 previous loans through ODEF and they have allowed her to maintain a stable business.  Now she is asking for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to buy supplies such as meats, soft drinks, condiments, vegetables, etc. to make food and drinks for sale.  Her goal is to always be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop to use for his studies.

loans.name: Diana's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of seven women who trade in various commodities, including slippers, underwear, cutlery sets, wax prints, palm fruits, onions, and eggs. 

Mary (standing, extreme left in the photograph) is a member of the Diana's Group. She is 60 years old, and has five adult children.  Her husband died when she was 50 years and she is currently living in the house the husband left for her and the children. Her major source of income is the selling wax prints, shoes, and slippers. She hawks these to customers, and sells to them.

Mary wants this loan to buy more wax prints and shoes to sell to customers. She sells to her customers in Teshie and Nungua towns; she has been in this business since 2006. 

Her dream is to make sure all children are place well in the society before she dies. 

Mary together with Agnes, Diana, Juliana, Helen, Rita, and Gladys need GHS 4,300 to increase stock and satisfy customer demands.

loans.use: To buy more wax prints, shoes, and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Kolu

texts.en:
Kolu is 27 years old and lives in Paynesville, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is living together with her fiancee and has two children, aged 1 and 7 years. Only one is attending school. Kolu, herself, is a university student. She is good at managing her business. Her fiancee is a builder.

For the past two years, Kolu has been selling body spray, soap, cream, etc., in the local market. Now she faces no problems; she sells every day and spends 12 hours per day on her business. She started this business with a little capital that she had received from her fiancee. She is requesting a loan to purchase more body spray, soap, cream, etc., to resell at her business.
