She hopes to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more body spray, soap, cream, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Chasquis Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHASQUIS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por siete  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Isidora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: hilado de lana de alpaca, venta de chamarras deportivas, venta de mochilas, costura de chamarras, tejido de awayos, venta de tucumanas, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Isidora es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas de alpaca; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás, en conjunto con una amiga que tenía, actualmente ya tiene su taller propio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias comunales y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The communal association “CHASQUIS” will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer (For Women) as part of the "Centro Focal de Panamericana" communal bank. The group is comprised of seven members and is governed by a Board of Directors and Isidora, their President.  The members of the communal association work in a variety of businesses including: alpaca wool spinning, selling sports jackets, selling knapsacks, sewing jackets, weaving textiles, selling meat-filled pastries, and weaving blankets. 

The loan they take out will benefit these small-business owners including Isidora. She states that this is her first time joining Pro Mujer (For Women). She became a member after being invited to do so by a Pro Mujer promoter who visited her home.  

She currently has a business weaving alpaca blankets. She began this business with a friend several years ago. She now has her own workshop.  The loan will be used to increase resources; to purchase wool from communal fairs. After using it to make her products she will sell them from her place of business. This type of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as best she can. She is married and has seven children. 

When people ask her why she likes Pro Mujer (For Women), her answer is that she likes its focus on health.

loans.use: to purchase wool

loans.name: Josue Onai

texts.es: Josue de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa. El posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que el realiza es excelente y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; él es un hombre muy dedicado a su trabajo responsable y honesto, Don Josue esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi el  podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida con su esposa.
texts.en: Josue is 42 years old and lives in a home of his own with his wife. He has a tailor shop in his home where he makes different types of clothing.  Lately he has gotten many customers because he does excellent work and sells for prices that are very accessible.  He is a man who is very dedicated to his work and is honest and responsible.  Josue is asking for a loan to buy fabric, thread, needles, and everything that has to do with sewing so that he can continue satisfying his customers’ needs.  In this way he can have a better quality of life with his wife.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Nubia Marleny

texts.es:
Nubia de 45 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos. Por la condición económica familiar, los dos deben trabajar para proporcionarle a la familia mejores condiciones de vida. En la actualidad se dedica en conjunto con uno de sus tres hijos a la distribución de productos lácteos en la localidad, actividad que alterna con la fabricación de arepas, las cuales son distribuidas en tiendas y mercados autoservicios. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una parrilla, un fogón de gas e insumos, con el propósito de aumentar su producción.
Su mayor deseo es acceder a la compra de una vivienda para ofrecerles a sus hijos una vida digna.
texts.en:
Nubia is 45 years old, married, and has three children.  Both she and her husband have to work to provide for the family due to financial conditions.  She and her husband, along with one of their sons, sell milk products in the local area.  She also makes bread and delivers it to stores and self-service markets.  She is asking for this loan to buy a grill, a cylinder of gas, and supplies so that she can increase her production.

Her greatest desire it so buy a house so that she can offer her children a decent life.

loans.use: to buy a grill and gas.

loans.name: Rodrigo Alexander

texts.es: Rodrigo de 34 años de edad. Trabaja como independiente en la venta de mercancía desde hace 15 meses. Gracias a su esfuerzo y disciplina estableció su negocio en un local. Allí comercializa calzado y prendas de vestir. Labora diariamente de ocho de la mañana a ocho de la noche. La idea de crear empresa surgió gracias a la oportunidad que tuvo de acceder a una capacitación gratuita para formar emprendedores. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el objetivo de adquirir surtido  y comprar las nuevas colecciones del mercado. Su mayor sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida familiar y expandir su negocio hasta convertirla en una multinacional.
texts.en: Rodrigo is 34 years old and for the past 15 months has been working on his own, selling merchandise.  Thanks to his effort and discipline, he set up a business where he sells shoes and clothing.  He works daily from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm.  He got the idea to start this business because of the opportunity he had to attend a free training session for entrepreneurs.  Now he is asking for a loan so that he can buy inventory and buy new collections.  His greatest dream is to improve his quality of life and grow his business until it becomes a multinational company.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Beldis Yolanda

texts.es: Beldis, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos y vive con ellos en una aldea de San Francisco, Atlántida. Ella estableció su propio negocio de sala de belleza en su casa, desde hace 4 años y presta el servicio de tintes, manicure, iluminaciones, tratamientos, peinados, alisados, secados y corte de pelo para damas. También vende producto de belleza. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo que es por 15,000 Lempiras el cual lo utilizara para comprar producto de belleza como tintes, tratamientos, cremas para cabello, champú etc. Para uso del salón y vender  a los clientes. Con los préstamos va  mejorando la atención a los clientes. Su objetivo es siempre sacar sus hijos adelante y tener mejor el negocio.
texts.en: Beldis is 44 years old, a single mother, has three children and lives with them in a suburb of San Francisco, Atlantida.  She set up her own beauty salon in her home four years ago and provides services such as tints, manicures, highlights, treatments, hairstyles, smoothing, washes, and women’s cuts.  She also sells beauty products.  She is asking for a second loan in the amount of 15,00 Lempiras which she will use to buy beauty products such as tints, treatments, hair creams, shampoos, etc. to use in her salon and also to sell to her customers.  The loans allow her to improve her customer service.  Her goal is to always get her children ahead and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Luisa Veronica

texts.es: Luisa Veronica 41 año de edad,  casada con dos hijos, originaria de Chichigalpa, zona donde predomina el ron la caña y azúcar, luisa es trabajadora permanente de uno de los ingenios de nuestro país, con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado ir mejorando su vivienda, ya que su salario no le permite acondicionarla mejor. luisa desea embaldosar cuartos ya que estos estan hondos y realizar ciertas mejoras en el techo de la vivienda, uno de sus sueños es terminar de mejorar su vivienda y seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que estos terminen sus estudios y puedan tener una mejor oportunidad en la vida, ella esta solicitando credito para la compra de cemento, arena, cal, piedrin, zin, entre otros materiales, ella esta muy agradecida con los inversionistas kivas por al ayuda que les brinda a personas de bajos recursos econimicos.
texts.en:
Luisa Veronica is 41 years old. She is married with two children. She is from Chichigalpa, an area known for rum and sugarcane. Luisa has a permanent job in one of our country’s sugar refineries. Her great efforts have enabled her to do up her home gradually, as her salary does not allow her to do so. Luisa would like to tile the rooms as the floors are not even, and to carry out certain improvement works to the roof. 

One of her dreams is to finish the improvement works to her house and to continue supporting her children until they complete their studies and are in a position to obtain better opportunities in life. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy cement, sand, lime, gravel, metal sheeting and other materials. She is very grateful to the Kiva investors for the help they give to people with scarce economic resources.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, sand, lime, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu is 37 years old and lives in Paynesville South, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 17. They are attending school, and living at home.

For the past five years, she has been selling soft drinks in the local  market. She makes more profit sometimes, but most of the time business goes slowly. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Comfort  S.

texts.en:
Comfort S. lives in Paynesville South, one of most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married with three children between the ages of 9 and 20; only two are attending school, and all of them live at home.  

For the past 19 years she has been selling biscuits, fresh  milk, candy, rice, pepper, charcoal, and oil in the local market. She makes a profit some time, but most of the time business is slow. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more biscuits, fresh milk, candy, rice, pepper, charcoal, and oil for her business. 

Her plan for the future is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, fresh milk, candy, rice, pepper, charcoal, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Yamah

texts.en: Yamah lives in Paynesville, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is 42 years old and she is married with three children aged between 4 and 25. Her children are currently in school and live at home. For the past 3 years she has been selling palm oil, salt, onions, vita, etc. in the local market. She started this business with a little amount she received from her husband. She enjoys the buying from her customers, and money that she generates from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, salt, onion, vita, etc. to enlarge her business. She plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, salt, onions, vita, etc. to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya.  She is married and has two children. She owns a service stall which deals in the sale of tap water. 

Florence learnt about Milango through a friend. Her main challenge is an unreliable water supply, and she looks to solve this by buying a water tank.

Florence is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy a water tank. She believes that the business has improved well enough to meet the required repayments for the loan, despite the high competition, and that she will be able to effectively provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Ruth Stella

texts.es:
Ruth de 52 años de edad, desde joven ha sido una apasionada por las ventas pero se dedicó a cuidar de sus tres hijos y su esposo se hizo responsable de las necesidades del hogar. Debido  a una crisis económica que padecieron, Ruth decidió emprender camino en el sector comercial y comenzó a vender productos por catálogo, actividad que le ha dejado buenas ganancias y quiere seguir realizando, motivo por el cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía a fin de tener un stock y aumentar su volumen de ventas. 
Su mayor deseo es montar su propio local en el que no sólo distribuya productos por catálogo si no ropa y accesorios. Se siente muy satisfecha porque gracias a su labor las condiciones de vida han mejorado para su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth is 52 years old and has had a passion for sales since she was very young, but she decide to be a stay home mother while her husband was responsible for providing for the household needs.  Due to the financial crisis they suffered, Ruth decided to start a business and began selling products via catalog.  This has provided her with good earnings and she wants to continue.  She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to have on hand and increase her sales.

Her greatest desire is to open her own store where she can not only sell via catalog, but also sell clothing and accessories.  She feels very satisfied because thanks to her work the family’s living conditions have improved.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen, tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes.  Doña María miro la necesidad de obtener ingresos para la manutención de sus hijos y hace un año decidió dedicarse a la venta de frutas de temporada y verduras. El puesto de venta lo tiene en su casa y vende a los vecinos. El préstamo que ha decidido solicitar es por 5,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en frutas, verduras y golosinas como churros, dulces y otros para vender. Su plan es aumentar las ventas y obtener ganancias para continuar con el negocio.
texts.en: María del Carmen is 58 years old, a single mother of two children, and lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  María saw the need to generate an income to support her children and a year ago decided to sell fruits and vegetables.  She has a stall at her house and sells to the neighbors.  She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Lempiras so she can buy fruits, vegetables, and snacks such as churros and other things to sell.  Her plan is to increase her sales and obtain earnings so she can continue her business.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra es una joven de 19 años de edad, motivada por lo sueños y las ganas de buscar un mejor futuro para sus padres. En la actualidad se dedica a laborar en una finca hotel, actividad que alterna con la venta de productos Amway con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y colaborar con los gastos de su casa. Su mayor deseo es ingresar a la universidad, sueño que cumplirá gracias a su empleo como independiente. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía con el objeto de cumplir con los pedidos que le han solicitado.
Espera que con su nuevo proyecto de negocios pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 19 year old young woman motivated by dreams and a desire to search for a better future for her parents.  She currently works at a hotel and also sells Amway products so she can increase her income and contribute to the household expenses.  Her greatest desire is to attend university, which she will achieve thanks to her sense of independence.  She is asking for a loan so she can buy merchandise to fill orders.

She hopes that this business project will help her improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Sor Caridad

texts.es:
Sor Caridad, se dedica a la venta de mercancía desde hace más de 10 años, gracias a su carisma y el buen servicio goza de una clientela permanente. Con el desarrollo de su actividad ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia lo que le permite sentirse satisfecha por el logro alcanzado.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de ropa y accesorios, con el fin de mejorar sus ventas. 
Su mayor sueño adquirir una vivienda y montar su propia tienda de ropa, pero tiene claro que esto será un proyecto a mediano plazo.
texts.en:
Sor Caridad has been selling merchandise for ten years.  Thanks to her charisma and good service, she has steady customers.  She has managed to improve her family’s quality of life with the development of her business.  This makes her satisfied for having reached her goal.  Now she is asking for a loan to buy clothing and accessories so she can increase her sales.

Her dream is to buy a house and open her own clothing store but she knows that this will be a medium term project.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married father of five children. He runs a cereals shop which has been in operation for three years. He is also a farmer.

James was introduced to Milango by his friends, and is asking for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy cereals for sale.

Despite the challenge of lack of capital, James believes he can save the extra income for the education of his children, provide a means of income to the other employees and also save the extra income for future needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals for sale.

loans.name: Eduar Javier

texts.es: Eduar, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene un hijo, reside en una aldea de la Masica, Atlántida. Hace 4 años que Eduar alquilo un local  en la comunidad y estableció su propio negocio de venta de celulares, repuestos y accesorios, venta de achinería y reparación de celulares. El negocio se ha mantenido por su buena administración y atención al cliente. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para surtir el negocio de mercadería para vender como ser celulares, accesorios y achinería. Con esta inversión espera aumentar las ventas y las ganancias. Su meta es que su hijo crezca sano, que pueda estudiar y que su negocio crezca cada dia más.
texts.en: Eduar is 22 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a son.  He lives in a suburb of Masica, Atlántida.  Four years ago, Eduar rented a shop in the community and set up his own business selling cell phones, spare parts, and accessories.  He sells thing for cell phones and does repairs.  He has managed the business well and gives good customer service.  He has decided to request a loan for 15,000 Lempiras to stock his store with merchandise such as cell phones, accessories, and things for cell phones.  He expects to increase his sales and earnings with the help of this loan.  His goal is for his son to be healthy, be able to attend school, and for his business to grow daily.

loans.use: to buy supplies and inventory.

loans.name: Laura Vanessa

texts.es: Laura, es una joven madre soltera de 38 años de edad, sola está intentando salir adelante con sus dos hijos quienes ya están grandes y estudian en un colegio público y muy pronto se tiene que preparar mas porque uno de ellos está por ingresar a la universidad y su sueño es verlos todos unos profesionales. Laura se dedica a la venta productos químicos de limpieza para el hogar, muchas veces carece de productos para vender por falta de recursos los cuales en su mayoría los destina para gastos del hogar pagos de colegios entre otros, por esta razón ella desea experimentar trabajar con  crédito el cual solicita para invertir en más productos químicos para continuar  vendiendo, siendo este su único medio de ingresos.
texts.en: Laura is a young, 38 year old, single mother.  She is only trying to get ahead with her two children who attend the public high school.  Soon she will have to be better prepared because one of them is about to begin university and her dream is to see them become professionals.  Laura sells cleaning chemicals for the home.  Many times she comes up short of chemicals due to lack of financial resources, most of which she uses to pay household expenses and to pay school expenses.  She wants to try working with a loan, so she is asking for a loan to buy more products so she can continue making sales.  This is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Berta Lidia

texts.es: Berta, tiene 42 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace 12 años que doña Berta estableció su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende  productos básicos alimenticios y venta de comida. vende granos básicos, manteca, huevo, azúcar, jabón, pan, refrescos, carnes, churros, lácteos etcEste negocio lo tiene en su casa al que le dedica todo el dia. ha mantenido varios prestamos con ODEF, actualmente solicita el ciclo numero 25, que es por un monto de 5,000 lempiras, con el cual va surtir la pulpería con productos como granos básicos, manteca, huevo, azúcar, refrescos, carnes, churros, lácteos etc. Ella espera que su negocio tenga estabilidad económica en un futuro.
texts.en: Berta is 42 years old, a widow, and has three children.  She lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  12 years ago Berta set us her own business, a convenience store where she sells basic foods and prepared food.  She sells basic grains, lard, eggs, sugar, soap, bread, soft drinks, churros, milk products, etc.  She runs her business out of her home and tends to it all day.  She has had several loans through ODEF, is now in her 25th cycle and is asking for 5,000 lempiras which she will use to stock her store.  She hopes that the will have financial stability in the future.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Iveth Magadalena

texts.es:
La  Joven Iveth, de 28 años, vive en su casa de habitación en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 05  años a la venta de refrescos y golosinas.
Iveth tiene su negocio  ubicado en su casa, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan
Iveth está solicitando  el crédito para la compra de cajas de refrescos, cebollas, chiles, plátanos verdes, papas, quesos, salsas, tomates, etc. y todo lo que necesita para preparar su venta y también para comprar al por mayor y almacenarlo porque le venden los productos más cómodos de esta manera.
Iveth espera poder obtener más ganancias en su negocio y su sueño es comprarse una freidora de pollo.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013.
texts.en:
Iveth is a 28 year old young woman.  She lives in her house in the San Lorenzo community in the southern part of Honduras.  She has been selling soft drinks and snacks for five years.  Iveth’s business is located in her house.  Her customers are her neighbors and friends who visit her daily.

Iveth is requesting the loan to buy cases of soft drinks, onions, chilies, green bananas, potatoes, cheeses, salsas, and tomatoes, etc.  She will buy everything that she needs in order to prepare for her sales.  She will buy wholesale and store it because they sell the products for better prices this way.

Iveth hopes to be able to get more profits in her business.  Her dream is to buy a chicken fryer.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – April 2013

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks, onions, chilies, green bananas, potatoes, cheeses, salsas, and tomatoes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To do finishing work to the outside of his house.

loans.name: Felipe Arnoldo

texts.es:
Don Arnoldo es originario del municipio de El Sauce, pueblo de leche y miel donde abundan estos insumos que se usan para muchas producciones.

Es un señor de 58 años, casado, padre de familia que se ha dedicado casi toda su vida a laborar como operador de los pozos de agua potable que abastecen a dicho municipio.

Toda su vida ha soñado con tener una vivienda digna que tenga todas las condiciones adecuadas para darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia. 

Por tal razón en este momento está solicitando un crédito a los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le otorgue un crédito para repellar dicha vivienda con el que piensa comprar cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra.

Tiene la fé en Dios que estos inversionistas de buen corazón le aprueben su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Arnoldo is from El Sauce, a town where milk and honey abound and are used in many products. He is 58, married and head of a family to whom his has dedicated almost his whole life, working as an operator for a drinking water well that supplies his town. All of his life he has dreamed of having a dignified home where he can give his family better living conditions. For this reason, he asks the Kiva lenders for a loan through Ceprodel in order to apply stucco to his home. He plans to buy cement, sand and pay for labor. 

He has faith in God that the good-hearted Kiva lenders will approve his request so that he can make his investment a reality.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and pay for labor.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is the head of a family of artisans in the Volta region of Ghana that specializes in traditional kente weaves. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of cotton yarn, for increasing production. Fred and his family have been selling through NOVICA since 2001. This is their story:

"We are a family of weavers who have been weaving kente cloths since 1821. Although the fratricidal wars have at one time or another endangered this ancient family business, the art has always been carried on or rejuvenated by another family member. I am the head of a family of twelve brothers and sisters - all kente weavers. Working on traditional looms, we use our whole body to work this intricate, ancient craft. Each color has its own meaning in Asante culture, and patterns are carefully chosen symbols, which the master weaver develops and names, often to honor people, historical events, or proverbs." 

"We appreciate the initiative that offers us this microcredit, because it makes it possible for us to purchase the raw materials that we work with. Bank loans in Ghana are very expensive, so we thank you very much for your support."

Use the link below to view Fred and family's kente weaves on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2644

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of cotton yarn, for increasing production

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a married father of three children. He owns a food café, which he has been operating for four years. He employs two other people in the café.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are competition and effect of seasonal changes. 

Bahati is applying for a loan of 15,850 Kenya shillings to buy food stock, e.g., rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking fat, etc. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his children and improve on his living standard. His dream is to open another food café.

loans.use: to buy food stock, e.g., rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es:
El señor Orlando José es un albañil que reside en la ciudad de Condega a unos 35 km al norte de la cabecera Estelí, este señor reside en su casa junto a sus tres hijos y es quien vela por la mantención de ellos ya que su esposa falleció de cáncer.

Este señor tiene mas de diez años de trabajar en el ramo de la construcción y el albañil y a diario el trabaja desde temprano en la construcción de casa de habitación de concreto y la supervisión de ellas ya que el cantata su propio personal para desempeñar dicha labor, el trabaja desde horas tempranas hasta la tarde y todos los días de la semana ya que trabaja bajo un contrato y por lo tanto tiene que entregar las obras en tiempo y forma.

Este cliente es la segunda vez que se presenta a las oficinas de Ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitar un financiamiento para la terminar de comprar materiales de construcción como es arena, Bloques, cemento, etc. 

Y de esta manera poder construir en totalidad su propia casa de habitación de concreto y darles a sus hijos un techo digno donde pueda vivir con tranquilidad. 

Este cliente tiene el sueño de heredarle a sus hijo una casa ya que de el depende únicamente el destino de sus hijo ya que no cuenta con la presencia y apoyo de la madre de sus hijos ya que ella falleció de cáncer y el espera que una vez otorgado el crédito por parte de Ceprodel pueda cumplirse el sueño a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Orlando José is a bricklayer who lives in the city of Condega, some 35 kilometers to the north of Estelí, the main town.  He lives in his house with his three children.  He's the one who watches over them because his wife died of cancer.

He has worked for more than ten years in construction and bricklaying.  He starts work early every day building houses of solid materials and supervising construction, because he hires his own staff to do this job.  He works every day of the week from very early until the afternoon because he works under contract and has to complete the jobs in a timely manner.

This is the second time this client has requested financing from CEPRODEL to finish buying construction materials such as sand, bricks, cement, etc.  This way he'll be able to construct his own house entirely of solid materials and give his children a decent home where they can live peacefully.

His dream is to leave his children a house because their future depends entirely on him: he doesn't have the presence and support of the mother of his children because she died of cancer.  He hopes that once the loan is granted by CEPRODEL he'll be able to fulfill his dream for his children.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, rebar, bricks, etc.

loans.name: Francis Esther

texts.es: Francis, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 8 años de edad, con quienes vive en una aldea de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Ella realiza la actividad agrícola junto a su esposo, con quien trabaja mancomunado para el sostenimiento de la familia. Desde hace varios años cultiva maíz, yuca y hortalizas. Estos productos los comercializan en la comunidad. Ha mejorado sus cultivos mediante préstamos, actualmente solicita el cuarto préstamo de 25,000.00 Lempiras, para comprar fertilizantes y darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de maíz y yuca. El propósito es sacar buenas cosechas y obtener ganancias que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y en un futuro tener su propio terreno para cultivar.
texts.en: Francis is 27 years old, married, and has two children ages 3 and 8, with whom she lives in a suburb of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  She farms with her husband and they work together to support the family.  For several years she has been raising corn, yucca, and vegetables and sells these products in the community.  They have improved their crops with the help of loans and are now asking for 25,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizer and maintain their corn and yucca crops.  The purpose is to have a good harvest and obtain earnings that will allow them to improve the family’s quality of life.  In the future she wants to have her own farmland.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: María, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, y vive en una aldea del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace un año que María estableció su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como granos básicos, pastillas, jabon. azúcar, manteca, huevos, sal, pan, etc. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ella atiende la pulpería todo el dia. Ha decidido obtener este préstamo por 20,000 lempiras para surtir la pulpería con productos de la canasta básica familiar como granos básicos, pan, sal, huevos, condimentos, productos enlatados, y otros para poder incrementar las ventas. Su meta es ampliar el negocio para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 43 years old, married, has three children, and lives in Choloma, Cortes.  A year ago Maria set up her own business; a convenience store where she sells basic food products such as basic grains, pills, soap, sugar, lard, eggs, salt, bread, etc.  Her husband is a farmer and she tends to the store all day.  She has decided to ask for this loan for 20,000 Lempiras in order to stock her store with family food products such as basic grains, bread, salt, eggs, condiments, canned goods, and other things in order to increase her sales.  Her goal is to expand her business so she can have better earnings.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a study.

loans.name: San Antonio De Jicamarca Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo  “San Antonio De Jicamarca” constituida por 11 socios emprendedores y responsables que pasan a su quinto ciclo. Este es el caso de Virginia una socia de 63 años casada y con 08 hijos la cual sigue apoyando a 01 de ellos. Con los deseos de mejorar su economía Virginia inicia su propio negocio de la crianza de cerdos. Ella comenzó trabajando en una hacienda donde se criaba dichos animales con los conocimientos y la experiencia  que adquirió decide emprender dicho negocio. Ya lleva más de 16 años trabajando de esta manera. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo a podido apoyar a sus hijos a salir adelante. Su último crédito lo destinó para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales. El mayor deseo de Virginia es ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente. El grupo “San Antonio De Jicamarca” agradecen el crédito brindado, ya que hace posible su progreso. Virginia es la cuarta del lado izquierdo y viste polo color maron y pantalón negro. Elvis no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
The San Antonio De Jicamarca group is comprised of 11 entrepreneurial and responsible members, who are in their fifth cycle.

This is the case with Virginia, a 63 year old member.  She is married and has eight children, one of whom she continues to support.  With the desire to improve financially, Virginia started her own business of raising pigs.  She started out working on a farm where they raised said animals.  With the knowledge and experience that she got, she decided to undertake said business.

She has now been working this way for over 16 years.  With the fruits of her effort she has been able to help her children get ahead.  She used her last loan to buy balanced feed for her animals.  Virginia’s greatest wish is to see her children become professionals.

The San Antonio De Jicamarca group is grateful for the loan that was granted because it makes progress possible.  

Virginia is the fourth one from the left.  She is wearing a brown top and black pants.

Elvis was not able to be present due to work.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Gladys Hortencia

texts.es: Gladys, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ella tiene su propio negocio en la casa desde hace 4 años donde presta el servicio de corte de pelo, planchado, tintes, alisado y venta de novedades como retrateras, floreros, colas, papel de regalo etc. Con ODEF a obtenido dos prestamos, el actual es por 14,000 Lempiras, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de tintes, tratamientos, cremas, champú y otros para uso en el salón de belleza y que sus clientes estén satisfechos. Su objetivo es expandir mas el negocio y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Gladys is 32 years old, a single mother with a daughter, and lives in the town of San Pedro Sula.  She has her own business in her home, where she has been providing haircuts, ironing, hair coloring, hair straightening, cutting and also selling novelties such as picture frames, vases, glues, wrapping paper, etc.

She has had loans through ODEF before and is asking for 14,000 Lempiras which she will use to buy tints, hair treatments, creams, shampoo, and other things for her salon so that her clients will be satisfied.

Her goal is to expand her business and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Beatrice N.

texts.en:
Beatrice N. is 53 years old, and lives in Paynesville. She is a widow and has four children between 29 and 30.  Their children are currently attending the University. 

Since 1990 she has been involved in business; currently she sells slippers in the Paynesville local market, which she has been doing for three years. She make a lot of profit and has many customers. 

Beatrice is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business.  Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install running water.

loans.name: Rosenda Yaneth

texts.es: Rosenda de treinta y dos años de edad vive junto a sus 3 hijos; ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad como frijoles, leche, pan, pollo, golosinas, refrescos, entre otros, el negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene 3 años de tenerlo, tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la conocen muy bien y la prefieren por la calidad de los productos que comercia, por los precios accesibles y sobre todo por el excelente servicio, Rosenda es una mujer dedicada a su labor, activa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, como toda buena comerciante quiere aumentar sus ventas pero para poder invertir necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar fríjoles, pan, golosinas, producto instantáneo, refrescos, etc. asi ella podra tener mejores ganancias para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosenda is 32 years old and lives with her three sons.  She has a store where she sells primary needs products, such as beans, milk, bread, chicken, snacks, soft drinks, and other things.  Her business is set up in her home and she has had it for three years.  She has many customers because people know her well and prefer the quality of the items she sells because of the good prices and above all the excellent service.

Rosenda is very dedicated to her work, active, and with a great desire to get ahead.  Like a good merchant, she wants to increase her sales but needs capital to invest.  She is asking for a loan which will allow her to buy beans, bread, snacks, instant products, soft drinks, etc.  In this way she can increase her income so she can provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Rosa Linda

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive en una colonia suburbana del municipio de Choloma, Cortes junto a su esposo y tres de sus hijos. En su casa tiene establecido un pequeño negocio donde vende frutas y verduras de la temporada como ser mangos, aguacates, bananos, patastes, zapotes, etc. el negocio tiene 5 años de funcionar y es reconocido en la comunidad. Esta solicitando un tercer préstamo a ODEF para surtir su negocio y mantener siempre producto fresco como es las frutas y verduras. Espera de esta inversión mejorar sus ventas. Su plan es obtener mejores ingresos para mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in a suburb of Choloma, Cortes, along with her husband and three of her children.

She has a small business set up in her home, where she sells seasonal fruits and vegetables, such as mangos, avocados, bananas, patastes, zapotes, etc.  She has had this business for five years and it’s well known within the community.  She is asking for a loan through ODEF so she can always have fresh products such as fruits and vegetables.  She hopes that her sales will increase and plans to increase her income in order to improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jaqueline María

texts.es:
Jaqueline María es una joven de 23 años, originaria de la comarca Las Mojarras del municipio de El Jicaral donde para llegar a su destino hay que atravesar un inmenso río caudaloso que en temporada de invierno se crece y es problema salir de dicho pueblo.

Es una joven emprendedora que a pesar de vivir tan alejado de la ciudad se preparó profesionalmente como profesora para salir adelante y hoy imparte clases a niños de primaria en la escuela de dicha localidad.

Uno de sus grandes sueños es tener su propia casa, ya que hace poco tiempo se casó y en conjunto con su esposo quieren luchar para lograr su sueño y brindarles buenas condiciones de vida a sus hijos en el momento que lleguen a sus vidas.

En estos momentos está solicitando un crédito para comprar ladrillos, cemento, arena y zinc con el fin de iniciar a construir dicha casa, ir poco a poco hasta llegar a tenerla toda.

Pide el apoyo a los inversionistas de Kiva y Ceprodel para que le apoyen con su solicitud donde quedará eternamente agradecida, ya que solamente a través de estos créditos se pueden cumplir los sueños de toda persona.
texts.en:
Jaqueline María is a 23 year old young woman from Las Mojarras, a rural area in the El Jicaral municipality.  In order to get to her place you need to cross an immense, fast-flowing river.  The river grows in the winter time, and it is difficult to leave her village. 

She is an enterprising young woman.  In spite of living so far from the city, she prepared professionally as a teacher in order to get ahead.  She now teaches classes to elementary school children in said location.

One of her biggest dreams is to have her own house.  She got married a little while ago, and she and her husband want to struggle together in order to achieve their dream.  They want to give their children good living conditions from the moment the children arrive in their lives.

She is now requesting a loan to buy bricks, cement, sand, and corrugated metal roofing in order to start building said house.  They will work little by little until they finish it all.

She is requesting the support of the Kiva lenders and Ceprodel so that they will help with her request.  She will be eternally grateful.  It is only through these loans that people are able to fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and corrugated metal roofing.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has six school-going children. He owns a service stall, which deals in the sale of tap water. He is also a charcoal seller. Joseph learned about Milango through a friend. His main challenge is an unreliable water supply. Joseph is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to install new pipes and buy a new stock of charcoal. He believes that the businesses have improved enough to meet the required repayments for the loan despite the high competition and he will be able to effectively provide for his family.

loans.use: To install new pipes and buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Gertrudis Aracely

texts.es: Doña Gertrudis de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee un negocio de pupuseria en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años trabaja de lunes a domingo , tiene mucha clientela pues las da a precios muy accesibles, y les da un buen servicio a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Gertrudis quiere acrecentar su negocio pero no tiene capital para poder realizarlo por eso solicita un credito que le permita comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus pupusas como: maiz, frijoles, chicharron, quesillo, entre otras cosas; tambien poder comprar mas mesas y sillas, para poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is 42 years old and lives in a home of her own along with her husband and son.  She has a pupusa restaurant in her home and has had it for ten years.  She works there Monday through Sunday and has many custoemers because her prices are good and she gives good customer service.  She uses her earnings  to help her husnand cover the household expenses.

Gertrudis wants togrow her business but doesn’t have the capital she needs, so she is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy what she needs to make pupusas, such as dried corn, beans, pork rinds, cheese, and other things.  She also wants to buy more tables and chairs to be able to increase her earnings and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and ingredients.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.es: Priscila, tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Tela. Ella lleva dos años de dedicarse a elaborar jugos naturales en bolsa y los vende helados, también vende bocadillos como pastelitos con carne, baleadas, y otros. el negocio lo tiene en su casa. Ella esta solicitando un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar materiales como madera, clavos, y pintura para remodelar el local y reubicar su negocio de venta de comidas y jugos naturales. Su sueño es tener su negocio bonito para mejorar los ingresos.
texts.en: Priscila  is 30 years old, married, has three children, and lives in a suburb of Tela.  She has been making natural juices for two years and sells them chilled.  She also sells snacks such as meat pies, baleadas, and other things.  The business is set up in her home.  She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras so she can buy supplies such as lumber, nails, and paint so she can remodel a place and relocate her food and juice business.  Her dream is to have a nice business so she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy materials to remodel her shop to better reposition her business.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru:
Айгуль 40 лет, одна воспитывает 3 детей. Айгуль в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав этот бизнес 10 лет назад с суммы (KGS) 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Айгуль в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 головы крупного рогатого скота, доход в месяц составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS).  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айгуль обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Айгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы обеспечить оплату обучения для своих детей.
texts.en: Aigul is 40 years old and raising three children alone.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started this business 10 years ago with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Aigul's persistent work, today her business contains three cattle, and the monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Aigul requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing the quantities of domesticated livestock in order to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Умедчон обратился за кредитом в нашу организацию в первый раз на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Умедчон по специальности плотник  и вот уже 10 лет, как занимается строительными услугами. Отец Умедчона по специальности врач и работает в сельской больнице. А мать и жена дома занимаются откормом скота вот уже 4 года, т.е. покупают, откармливают и продают скот. Умедчон за полученный кредит планирует отремонтировать дом, так как его дом имеет плохое состояние и расширение места для содержания скота. Его бизнес год за годом развивается и поэтому он должен расширить место для содержания скота. Он также занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Полученный урожай, то есть ячмень, он использует для откорма скота. Умедчон надеется на нашу финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Umedjon came to our organization for the first time for a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni needed to purchase construction materials.  Umedjon is a carpenter and has been involved in construction services for 10 years.  Umedjon's father is a doctor and works at a village hospital, and mother and wife have been involved in fattening up livestock at home for 4 years, specifically they buy, fatten up and sell livestock.  Umedjon plans to use this loan to repair his house because it is in a bad condition, and to expand the space for keeping livestock.  His business grows year-after-year and this is why he needs to expand the space for keeping livestock.  He is also involved in growing agricultural crops.  He uses his harvest of barley to feed the livestock.  Umedjon relies on our financial support.

loans.use: to repair his house and expand space for livestock

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has four children. He owns a retail shop, a business that has been running for six years. In this business, he sells retail stock e.g. rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil etc. He also runs a transport business.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the high cost of products.
 
Peter is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock like sugar, flour etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like sugar, flour etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Teresita has requested a loan of 17,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Vilma is 45 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Vilma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 11500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing equipment for her business.

Vilma has been in this business for one year. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing equipment for her business.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: maria de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su epsoso y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda desde hace 6 años en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como: shampoo, papel higenico,etc. con las ventas que realiza y la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante en su hogar, pero ella quiere surtir su negocio con mas producto pero no posee de capital por eso solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar mas mercaderia como: jabon para baño, jabon para ropa, detergentes, papel higenico, entre otras cosas asi como muestra la fotografia  y pueda obtener mejores ganancias para seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesita sin ninguna limitacion
texts.en: Maria is 36 years old and lives in a home of her own, along with her husband and two children.  She has had a store for six years where she sells all types of products such as shampoo, bathroom tissue, etc.  She helps his husband with her sales and they manage to come out ahead in their home.  She wants to stock her business with more products, but doesn’t have the capital, so she is asking for a loan so she can buy more merchandise such as bathroom soap, detergents, bathroom tissue, and other things as shown in the photo, so she can have better earnings and continue to provide her family with what they need without limits.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Fátima Leonor

texts.es:
Fátima Leonor es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, un pueblo lleno de tradiciones religiosas y culturales donde todos sus pobladores se conocen por lo pequeño que es dicho pueblo.

Hace 30 años se graduó como maestra de primaria y hoy ejerce el cargo de sub directora de un colegio ubicado a 7 km de dicho municipio donde tiene que viajar en motocicleta para estar puntual en su centro de trabajo.

Es una mujer luchadora que toda su vida ha logrado con esfuerzo propio sus objetivos sobre todo sacar adelante a sus hijos. Su gran sueño es ver terminada su casa con todas las condiciones.

En este momento tiene la necesidad de un crédito para comprar zinc, cemento, ladrillos y perlines con el fin de mejorar la cocina antes de que entre la temporada de invierno y solamente con la ayuda de estos financiamientos se pueden lograr grandes sueños.

Se siente muy agradecida y satisfecha con Kiva y Ceprodel por el apoyo que le ha brindado con estos créditos ya que gracias a ello ha construido su casa y con lo poco que gana no hubiera podido lograrlo.
texts.en:
Fátima Leonor comes from the town of El Sauce, a village which is full of cultural and religious traditions. All its inhabitants know each other because of how small the village is.

She graduated as an elementary school teacher 30 years ago. Today she holds the position of vice principal at a school located 7 kilometers from the village. She needs to commute on a motorcycle in order to get to her workplace on time.

She's a hard-working woman who has always accomplished her goals through her own efforts, especially the goal of getting her children ahead. Her biggest dream is to see her house finished with all the right conditions.

She currently needs a loan in order to purchase zinc, cement, bricks and nails so that she can improve her kitchen before the winter season comes. Only with the help of these loans can great dreams be achieved.

She feels very thankful and satisfied with Kiva and Ceprodel for the support she has received from these loans. Thanks to them she has built her house, which she wouldn't be able to do with her low income.

loans.use: to purchase zinc, cement, bricks and nails.

loans.name: Alii

texts.en: Alii is grateful for the first loan he received. It has helped him grow the business. He established a grocery stall from the proceeds of the first loan. He is therefore asking for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to buy more grocery stock like vegetables and fruits for sale. He believes the business has picked up well and will meet the required

loans.use: To buy more grocery stock like vegetables and  fruits to sell

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 33 years old and has four children currently going to school. Jovelyn is in the agriculture business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now. She has used loans from NWTF six times in the past to help her sustain her business.

Jovelyn has requested a loan of 17,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more rice to sell. In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

Andresa has requested a loan for 19,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment for her business. In the future, Andresa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment for her business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38 years old and married with two children. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and she works hard to provide for her family. She has been in the charcoal business for four years and also earns income through retail sales of rice. 

Mary Jane has borrowed and repaid seven previous loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a loan for 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.
 
Mary Jane aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 52 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by engaging in a van-for-hire business in the Philippines. Sonia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her van.

Sonia has been in the van-for-hire business for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her van.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Rosemarie requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional equipment for fishing, like fishing net, hook, wood, etc. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for fishing, like fishing net, hook, wood, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es: Bertha, tiene 47 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tienen dos hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella lleva mas de 20 años de dedicarse al comercio, vende frutas de temporada, jilotes, tamarindo y materiales desechables como botellas de refrescos, lata, hierro, chatarras, aluminio, llantas, bronce etc. La fruta la vende en el mercado local y los materiales desechables los vende en las fábricas de reciclaje. Esta solicitando el quinto préstamo que es por 12,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar materiales desechables como hierro, artículos en mal estado, plásticos etc. para vender. Su meta es lograr comprar un vehículo para trabajar mejor.
texts.en: Bertha is 47 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children.  She lives in a suburb of Choloma, Cortes and has been a merchant for more than 20 years.  She sells seasonal fruits, cornstalks, tin, iron, junk, aluminum, tires, bronze, etc.  She sells the fruit at the local market and the other discards to recyclers.  She is asking for her fifth loan of 12,000 Lempiras which she will use to buy discards such as iron, broken items, plastics, etc. to sell.  Her goal is to buy a vehicle to be able to work better.

loans.use: to buy recyclables.

loans.name: Zalimon

texts.en: Zalimon is a 25-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. Four years ago, he decided to venture into the transport business. Specifically, he rides a motorcycle. The poor road network and the high cost of fuel affect his progress. His dreams are educating his children and diversifying his business to include farming. Zalimon intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a 36-year-old man with six children, three of whom attend school. He has a depot of drinks in a trading center in Bundibugyo, Uganda, which he has been running since 2009. He gets additional income from his cocoa business. He began the business to get profits and care for his family. The purpose of the loan is to buy more sodas and beer to sell. He has a dream of expanding his business to new markets despite the challenge of inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy more sodas and beer to sell.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda, 41, is a mother of two children. One of the children is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Linda requested a PHP 16,500 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy fishing equipment and supplies for boat maintenance, like net, paints, wood, bamboo, etc. In the future, Linda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment and supplies for boat maintenance

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, sugar, spices and canned goods. In the future, Arlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, sugar, spices and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and farm equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make home repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise, blenders, tables, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en: Mrs. Oyungerel, 46 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a conductor at a train station for 26 consecutive years and is considered by many to be the best staff in her specialty. Her husband has been selling and transporting coal and timber at an outdoor market. Her daughter studies accountancy at college and will graduate this summer. Her son lives separately from his parents on his own. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to pay for her daughter's college tuition fee. As a result, her daughter can graduate this summer with a diploma in accountancy and will be able to look for jobs. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who greatly cares for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's college tuition fee

loans.name: Cherry Ann

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Cherry Ann works hard to support her family. She has a welding shop in the Philippines, and also earns income from a mobile prepaid load service.

Cherry Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF and is now requesting a new loan of PHP 29500 to buy additional equipment for her welding shop. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment for her welding shop.

loans.name: Alpina

texts.en: Alpina is 45 years old and married. She earns a living by raising pig in the Philippines. Alpina is borrowing PHP 1,0000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs. Alpina has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from selling dried coconut meat.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Amarsanaa

texts.en: Mr. Amarsanaa, 41 years old, lives with his son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling a wide variety of souvenirs since 2005 and accumulated a vast amount of experience in souvenir sales. Before running his business, he, together with his brothers, had worked at a framing factory and learned necessary skills used for framing. His son is unemployed and currently stays at home while his daughter goes to secondary school. His wife works in the United States of America on an employment contract. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase picture framing equipment. Using this equipment, he can save more time than using his hand tools. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who greatly cares for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase picture framing equipment

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan works hard to support her family.  Susan is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.  Susan has been in this business for eight years now.  In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Otgontsetseg, 33 years old, lives with her husband, daughter and parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her parents have retired from work and now get a state pension. Her husband is unemployed and currently stays at home. Her daughter goes to secondary school. She herself has been working as a legal advisor at the taxation department of the district. Before this job, she had worked as an auditor in the internal affairs department of an oil importing company. Her sister studies at university and can't afford to pay her tuition fee. So Otgontsetseg is requesting a loan of 850,000 MNT to pay for her sister's tuition fee. After her sister's graduation from university, she can contribute to the family income generation. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to pay for her sister's tuition fee

loans.name: Tumenbayar

texts.en:
This is Tumenbayar. She is 54 years old, a mother of three children and also a good wife. Her elder daughters work out of the city while she lives with her spouse and son, who attends a local high school. 

Tumenbayar supports her family by writing and selling books. She wrote about 10 books before.   She usually writes historical and fictional books for children. Most of her customers are kids who love to read books. With the previous loan, she published the book is called “Golden Coin of Queen Durgunu”, and all her books are sold. 

She needs to publish more books, which she will sell at local indoor book stores in UB city. Thus, she is requesting a 3,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to publish books. 

“When sometimes I take too long to publish my books, children often ask from booksellers: when the next book will be ready to sell? Then booksellers ask me that question. In that moment I become really happy and get more energy from those words,” she said from the heart.

loans.use: to publish books and sell at the local indoor markets for the children.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 51 years-old and married with three children.

Crisanta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional items such as eggs, rice, sugar, shampoo, soap, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Crisanta has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and farming vegetables.

Crisanta aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as eggs, rice, sugar, shampoo, soap, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Unenbat

texts.en:
Borrower Unenbat is a 29 year-old glazier who lives in the outer ger district of the city. Currently, he lives with a young lady with whom he has a relationship.  As an young man he is very hardworking guy. He is planning to build a house for his younger brother who is planning to marry. 

Therefore, he is requesting a 2.000.000 MNT loan in order to build the fundamentals of a house for his younger brother. He said: "I'm a brother of my younger brother, so I have to help and support him when he needs my help, therefore I'm really happy for my brother for his marriage".

loans.use: to build the fundamentals of a house for his younger brother.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 46 years-old and married with four children.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Estrella has borrowed and repaid 35 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs, a general store and hallow block making.

Estrella aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 64 years old and widowed.  She has four children. Felisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like bread, oil, soysauce, eggs, sugar, etc. to sell in her general store.

Felisa has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling native products. Felisa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like bread, oil, soysauce, eggs, sugar, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Battur

texts.en:
Borrower Battur is a 31-year-old married man who has three children and lives with his family in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. He works as a driver in a local non-governmental organization as well as operating a small work and clothing shop with help from his wife.

Besides their business, his wife sews a traditional deel /national dress/ and they really enjoy their business and their work. He bought a sewing machine with a previous loan.  Now he is requesting a 2,500,000 loan to purchase more clothes and accessories for upcoming graduation season.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell for upcomig graduation season.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Flordeliza works hard to support her family.  She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.  Flordeliza is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy more farm land and save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a used clothes business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell for her business.  Gemma has been in this business for two years. Gemma earns additional income from direct selling of Avon products.  Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundle of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is 34 years old, married, and works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Geraldine is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her food vending and general store business.  Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food vending

loans.name: Leonis

texts.en:
Leonis is 48 years old and married with three children.

Leonis works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, spices, egg, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Leonis has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and earns an additional income from selling mobile prepaid loads.

Leonis aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, spices, egg, noodles, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  Lolita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 48 years old and married with two children.

Emily works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, spices, noodles, etc.

Emily has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction).

Emily aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, spices, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Hailyn

texts.en:
Hailyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 1,2000 through NWTF to purchase additional baskets of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Hailyn has been in this business for five years. Hailyn earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains.

Hailyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional baskets of fish to sell

loans.name: Kerana

texts.en: As a married parent of one child, Kerana works hard to support her family. She has a banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Kerana is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell for her business.  Kerana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Alvaro David

texts.es:
Álvaro David, es un joven emprendedor, Sauceño de nacimiento y de corazón, padre de familia muy responsable que lo primero para él es su familia.

Se graduó como maestro de educación primaria porque desde muy pequeño soñaba con dar clases y enseñar a los demás a leer y escribir para que sean personas de bien.

Hoy en la actualidad es el director de un centro de estudio ubicado en una comarca aledaña al municipio, ya que después de tantos años de ejercer un buen trabajo fue promovido para este cargo.

Gracias al esfuerzo propio adquirió un terreno a la orilla de dicho municipio donde empezó a construir su propia casa y la que ha ido ampliando a lo largo de los años.

Con el fin de construir un cuarto para tener mejores condiciones para él y su familia está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel con el que piensa comprar ladrillos, cemento, arena, zinc, perlines y pago de mano de obra.

Espera y confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel le financien este crédito para lograr su objetivo donde quedará eternamente agradecido por este apoyo incondicional a las personas de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Alvaro David is a young entrepreneur, a person from El Sauce by birth and in his heart, and a very responsible father who puts his family first.

He graduated as a teacher of primary education because from early childhood, he wanted to offer classes and teach others to read and write, so that they could become respectable people.

Today, Alvaro David is director of a studies center located in an outlying area of the city, having been promoted to this responsible position after many years of performing good work.

Thanks to his own efforts, Alvaro David acquired a piece of land on the edge of this municipality where he began to construct his own house. He has been expanding it over a period of years.

For the purpose of constructing a room to provide better conditions for himself and his family, Alvaro David is soliciting a loan through Ceprodel to purchase bricks, cement, sand, zinc sheets, and rafters, and to pay construction workers.

He hopes and trusts in God that Kiva investors, through Ceprodel, will finance this loan so that he can achieve his objective. Alvaro David will remain eternally grateful for this unconditional help for people of scarce resources.

loans.use: buy bricks, cement, sand, zinc sheets, and rafters, and to pay construction workers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling cashew nuts in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional cashew nuts to sell for her buying and selling cashew nuts business.

Evelyn has been in this business for nine years. Evelyn earns more income from her general store.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Borrower Ms.Purevsuren is a 57 year-old married woman.  She has a 17-year-old daughter who attends high school and a son who is married. She lives with her spouse and daughter in a small apartment. 

She supports her family by operating a wool products manufacturing business. She purchases combed wool and then she manufactures products with the wools.  After that, she sells the products to local indoor markets and others.

She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase combed wool, since the cost is cheaper during the spring season.
